Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data Analyst




Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join the COO Reporting Team, inside the COO domain.

The responsibility of this team is to establish a fit-for-future and data-driven COO domain through simplified and automated access to data & reporting.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Data Analyst you will:

Develop and automate reports / dashboards and gather the requirements of the stakeholders to establish the Business Intelligence and analytical needs of each area.
Execute quantitative analyses that translate data into actionable insights; provide analytical and data-driven decision-making support for key projects.
Manage and respond to internal and external, requests and queries including a variety of reporting requirements.
Performance reporting: Prepare updates on business and performance metrics (OKRs / KPIs).

What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!




The candidate:




Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science / Engineering / Mathematics or related technical discipline.
Work experience of at least 2 years in a related field.
Experience with analytical tools supporting data evaluation and reporting, as well as querying large complex data sets (PL/SQL, SAS, etc.).
Experience in the use of Python.
Experience in the use BI tooling, such as PowerBI or MicroStrategy.
Demonstrated use of analytics, metrics, and benchmarking to drive decisions.
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English).
Able to work in an autonomous way, to take initiative and to make things happen with a can-do attitude.
Problem solving mindset.
Flexible, dynamic, capable of working in multidisciplinary environments in coordination with the rest of the areas.




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but‚Ä¶ What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues‚Äô needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.

Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn‚Äôt take up your time or your cravings.




Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!




Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.




Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids‚Ä¶




Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.




Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!




More vitality and more belonging

360¬∫ care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+), Leonas & RI√ëG.

International Remote work program.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1700 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team, and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead‚Äîthat‚Äôs our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working‚Ä¶we are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¬øTienes ganas de dar forma al futuro de los seguros?

En Prima, podr√≠as asumir un reto totalmente nuevo. Como parte de nuestra comunidad global, estar√°s en el asiento del conductor de tu carrera, aprendiendo y creciendo con un equipo de primer nivel a tu alrededor. Prima es un lugar en el que, independientemente de qui√©n seas o cu√°l sea tu funci√≥n, se valora tu voz.

En 2015, nos embarcamos en una misi√≥n: ofrecer un seguro de coche de gran valor dise√±ado para todos. Y hemos recorrido un largo camino, hemos creado una cultura en la que podemos impulsar el √©xito de los dem√°s. Pero necesitamos tu experiencia, ya que dirigimos las cosas en una direcci√≥n nueva y emocionante.

Probablemente est√©s pensando... "Esto suena muy bien". Estamos de acuerdo.

Hemos configurado nuestra oferta para centrarnos en el bienestar, la autonom√≠a y el desarrollo. Consideramos que los beneficios son el combustible que te permitir√° alcanzar el √©xito si decides embarcarte en este viaje con nosotros.

ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Trabajar de la mejor manera para ti

Creemos en la conciliaci√≥n y la flexibilidad. Tanto si te gusta trabajar desde la oficina, desde casa o una mezcla de ambas. Te ayudaremos a encontrar el equilibrio que mejor se adapte a ti. Incluso tenemos una pol√≠tica que te permite trabajar desde cualquier lugar durante 30 d√≠as al a√±o. Confiamos en ti para que nos ayudes a avanzar.

üèÅ La libertad de explorar las posibilidades

En Prima nos movemos r√°pido, pero nos movemos juntos. Invertimos en tu crecimiento; por eso te daremos acceso a un mercado de ense√±anza y aprendizaje. Y tendr√°s sesiones regulares con tu manager para establecer un plan de crecimiento personal.

üåà Nuestra f√≥rmula ganadora: felices y de alto rendimiento

Desde seguros m√©dicos privados hasta descuentos en gimnasios e iniciativas de bienestar: estamos aqu√≠ para ayudarte. Sabemos lo importantes que son tu salud y tu bienestar, as√≠ que haremos todo lo posible para ayudarte.

Si te parece que tenemos algo para ti, veamos si tienes las aptitudes que buscamos

Te incorporar√°s como Data Analyst en el equipo de Online Sales & Marketing para apoyar a identificar y mejorar iniciativas de crecimiento y de eficiencia del negocio, analizando los principales factores que est√°n afectando y/o condicionando nuestro desempe√±o y resultados en ventas y en retenci√≥n de p√≥lizas.

En concreto, trabajar√°s con los diferentes equipos de Prima, con las siguientes responsabilidades:

Conversi√≥n online


Analizar los factores que impactan la conversi√≥n del funnel de los usuarios que llegan a nuestra p√°gina web por los diferentes canales, apoy√°ndote en el an√°lisis detallado de datos y en herramientas de an√°lisis web e interactuando con equipos de Product y de UX para identificar mejoras.
Crear y mantener dashboards en Tableau para respaldar las decisiones estrat√©gicas del equipo de Online Sales y dar soporte a los equipos de Product y Product Analytics.
Implementar un sistema de intercambio de datos con otros equipos locales y globales de la compa√±√≠a.
Fomentar iniciativas destinadas a aumentar la conversi√≥n online y mejorar la experiencia de usuario.
Trabajar con nuestros partners externos como Comparadores para mejorar nuestro posicionamiento y darles soporte en desarrollos que mejoren la experiencia de los usuarios y su potencial de conversi√≥n.


Eficiencia operativa


Analizar oportunidades para mejorar la eficiencia del equipo de Atenci√≥n al Cliente, dando soporte al Team Leader, a partir de los datos de las interacciones con clientes.
Fomentar iniciativas destinadas a mejorar los resultados y la contribuci√≥n de los agentes.
Crear dashboards de monitoreo y an√°lisis de desempe√±o con respecto a la fuente, el tipo de interacciones y actividades del cliente para mejorar la eficiencia.


Otras √°reas


Trabajar con otros Data Scientists y Data Analysts de la compa√±√≠a para desarrollar y fortalecer la cultura de datos de Prima, buscando y compartiendo mejores pr√°cticas.
Dar soporte a la Head of Online Sales & Marketing en iniciativas y proyectos estrat√©gicos, como el lanzamiento de nuevos canales online, o la definici√≥n de modelos de atribuci√≥n.


¬øQu√© buscamos?

Ser√≠as ideal para el equipo si cumples estos requisitos:


Al menos 3 a√±os de experiencia en an√°lisis de datos.
Buena experiencia en la creaci√≥n de datasets utilizando diferentes herramientas para manipulaci√≥n y extracci√≥n de datos (MySQL, Redshift, PostgreSQL).
Buenas habilidades de visi√≥n de negocio.
Habilidades anal√≠ticas y experiencia en la creaci√≥n de modelos en Excel o Tableau.
Grado universitario en campos afines al an√°lisis de datos (Estad√≠stica, Matem√°ticas, Ingenier√≠a, Inform√°tica, ADE o Econom√≠a).
Nivel de ingl√©s medio-avanzado, imprescindible para comunicarse entre los equipos globales.


Ser√≠a fant√°stico si...

Adem√°s de los requisitos b√°sicos, evaluaremos con atenci√≥n las siguientes caracter√≠sticas:


Experiencia usando herramientas de web analytics como Google Analytics y Content Square.
Buenas habilidades interpersonales y de negociaci√≥n, resoluci√≥n de problemas, determinaci√≥n.
Flexibilidad y actitud adaptativa.
Iniciativa y proactividad.
Experiencia con otras diferentes herramientas tecnol√≥gicas.


Prima es una comunidad formada por personas con talento y ambici√≥n. Ofrecemos igualdad de oportunidades de empleo y estamos orientados hacia la diversidad y la inclusi√≥n en el lugar de trabajo. Prohibimos todo tipo de discriminaci√≥n por motivos de raza, color, sexo, religi√≥n, orientaci√≥n sexual, nacionalidad, discapacidad, informaci√≥n gen√©tica, embarazo u otras caracter√≠sticas personales protegidas, tal y como se definen en la legislaci√≥n nacional.

Si te parece que encajamos bien, √∫nete a nosotros en el fast lane.

Title: Data Analyst (Finance)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analysts who don't believe there's a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Supporting the Finance team in controlling market products, including market making and treasury investments
Analysing and optimising financial control and treasury management activities
Understanding business processes through financial data and ensuring accuracy from booking to accounting
Developing Price Verification Models to ensure accurate valuation of financial products
Automating financial controls to improve efficiency and compliance
Designing and implementing reconciliation logic for balance accuracy
Creating and maintaining dashboards to track key financial metrics
Collaborating with Market Making, Treasury, and Financial Control teams to enhance reporting and decision-making

5+ years of experience working with Data Analysis and creating impactful solutions
Ability to manage a team and stakeholders
Excellent background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Previous experience working on a Finance department


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analysts who don't believe there's a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Supporting the Finance team in controlling market products, including market making and treasury investments
  • Analysing and optimising financial control and treasury management activities
  • Understanding business processes through financial data and ensuring accuracy from booking to accounting
  • Developing Price Verification Models to ensure accurate valuation of financial products
  • Automating financial controls to improve efficiency and compliance
  • Designing and implementing reconciliation logic for balance accuracy
  • Creating and maintaining dashboards to track key financial metrics
  • Collaborating with Market Making, Treasury, and Financial Control teams to enhance reporting and decision-making

What You'll Need

  • 5+ years of experience working with Data Analysis and creating impactful solutions
  • Ability to manage a team and stakeholders
  • Excellent background / education in a quantitative discipline
  • Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
  • Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge

Nice to have

  • Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
  • Previous experience working on a Finance department

Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

  • Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
  • Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including EA SPORTS Madden NFL, FC, NHL, NBA LIVE, PGA TOUR and UFC.

There are millions of EA SPORTS players generating billions of events every day. We are using the high-volume data streams to detect and anticipate Security threats and issues as soon as they occur. The Game Security Data Analyst will be an essential EA SPORTS Security Team member. Reporting to the Development Director - Game Security, you will support the SOC lead and the Security Data Scientists by ensuring partners can receive and understand relevant information promptly to help keep our Sports games safe and secure.This is a hybrid role that is located in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Analyse data to support business decisions and security operations
Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions
Communicate findings, issues and trade-offs to team members
Adopt a security mindset to predict the adversary's moves and ensure the right Data is available to detect them.
Think and solve complex data problems in a maintainable and scalable fashion


Required Qualifications


2 years experience
Proficiency with SQL and no-SQL databases.
Knowledge and experience with data gathering, analysis, and visualization tools
Some knowledge and experience working with Python
Experience with data visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker


About Electronic Arts

We‚Äôre proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
üß† Data Analyst

Ubicaci√≥n: Madrid (formato h√≠brido)

üåü Sobre el proyecto

En Brainy Commerce ayudamos a empresas a aprovechar todo el potencial de los grandes marketplaces como Amazon, Mercado Libre y Wallmart, Alibaba (Aliexpress, Miravia) y ahora tambi√©n Tik Tok Shop, impulsando sus ventas locales e internacionales. Tenemos en marcha una herramienta digital que da visibilidad sobre el rendimiento, la publicidad y el mercado, integrando datos de m√∫ltiples fuentes en tiempo real.

Como analista de datos, ser√°s parte fundamental en este proceso, ayudando a convertir datos complejos en insights accionables para nuestros equipos y nuestros clientes. Este puesto va mucho m√°s all√° de generar dashboards o paneles: buscamos un perfil anal√≠tico, curioso y orientado al negocio.







üéØ Tus responsabilidades

Analizar grandes vol√∫menes de datos relacionados con ventas, pricing, competencia, etc.
Dise√±ar y mantener dashboards interactivos en Power BI, que aporten valor a negocio y consultor√≠a.
Colaborar estrechamente con los equipos de cuentas, data engineering y marketing para definir necesidades de reporting.
Proponer mejoras continuas en los modelos de an√°lisis de datos.
Contribuir activamente en el dise√±o del producto desde la perspectiva de los datos.
Validar insights con stakeholders internos y clientes.







üß© Lo que buscamos

1‚Äì2 a√±os de experiencia como analista de datos o posici√≥n similar.
Conocimientos avanzados de Power BI (medidas DAX, modelado de datos, dashboards).
Capacidad para estructurar datos de distintas fuentes y generar reportes autom√°ticos y eficientes.
Nivel intermedio en SQL.
Deseable: conocimientos b√°sicos en Python, APIs, o herramientas de automatizaci√≥n de datos.
Deseable: experiencia previa en e-commerce, marketplaces o SaaS.







üß† Perfil ideal

Te obsesiona entender el por qu√© detr√°s de los datos.
Te entusiasma contar historias con gr√°ficos, no solo con n√∫meros.
Tienes mentalidad de producto: entiendes c√≥mo los datos impactan en decisiones reales.
Te gusta colaborar con otros perfiles (tech, negocio, marketing).
Eres organizado/a y sabes comunicar hallazgos complejos de forma clara.







üöÄ Qu√© te ofrecemos

Formaci√≥n continua en negocio, visualizaci√≥n, automatizaci√≥n y modelado de datos.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/*)
Description:
Thank you for your interest in working for our Company. Recruiting the right talent is crucial to our goals. On April 1, 2024, 3M Healthcare underwent a corporate spin-off leading to the creation of a new company named Solventum. We are still in the process of updating our Careers Page and applicant documents, which currently have 3M branding. Please bear with us. In the interim, our Privacy Policy here: https://www.solventum.com/en-us/home/legal/website-privacy-statement/applicant-privacy/ continues to apply to any personal information you submit, and the 3M-branded positions listed on our Careers Page are for Solventum positions. As it was with 3M, at Solventum all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Job Description

3M Health Care is now Solventum

At Solventum, we enable better, smarter, safer healthcare to improve lives. As a new company with a long legacy of creating breakthrough solutions for our customers‚Äô toughest challenges, we pioneer game-changing innovations at the intersection of health, material and data science that change patients' lives for the better while enabling healthcare professionals to perform at their best. Because people, and their wellbeing, are at the heart of every scientific advancement we pursue.

We partner closely with the brightest minds in healthcare to ensure that every solution we create melds the latest technology with compassion and empathy. Because at Solventum, we never stop solving for you.

The Impact You‚Äôll Make in this Role

As a Data Analyst (m/f/*) In The EMEA DS Sales Excellence Team, You Will Have The Opportunity To Tap Into Your Curiosity And Collaborate With Some Of The Most Innovative And Diverse People Around The World. Here, You Will Make An Impact By


EMEA DS data analysis including internal data and external raw data to provide data-based insights to drive growth and increase share of wallet
Advanced Analytics: Perform complex data analysis using Power BI's DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and Power Query to deliver actionable insights
SQL Expertise: Write complex SQL queries for data extraction and transformation. Work closely with data engineers to ensure efficient data pipelines are in place.
Snowflake Integration: Work with Snowflake databases for data storage, retrieval, and transformation. Optimize SQL queries to efficiently extract and manipulate data within Snowflake.
Power BI Security Model: Implement and manage Power BI security configurations such as row-level security (RLS) to ensure data security and privacy compliance.
Collaboration & Communication: Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand reporting needs and translate them into actionable Power BI solutions.
Data Quality & Integrity: Ensure high-quality, accurate, and consistent data by performing data validation and quality checks.
Performance Optimization: Optimize Power BI reports and dashboards for faster load times and overall better performance.
Documentation & Training: Create and maintain documentation for Power BI dashboards, data models, and security configurations. Train end-users on the use of Power BI reports and features.


Your Skills And Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, Solventum requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field
Profound experience in Power BI development and analytics
Profound experience in Power BI or BI Tool‚Äôs development with proven experience in building dashboards and reports from scratch
Proficiency in SQL, Snowflake, Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, and related tools such as Power Query and DAX for advanced calculations
Experience with advanced analytics techniques such as predictive modeling, statistical analysis, or machine learning integration into Power BI
Understanding of data warehousing concepts and experience working with large data sets
Knowledge of data visualization best practices to ensure clarity and usability of reports and dashboards
Strong attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines


Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status.

Supporting Your Well-being

Solventum offers many programs to help you live your best life ‚Äì both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, Solventum regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

Diversity & Inclusion

(*) We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, civil status, disability, family status, or membership of the travelling community.

Solventum is committed to maintaining the highest standards of integrity and professionalism in our recruitment process. Applicants must remain alert to fraudulent job postings and recruitment schemes that falsely claim to represent Solventum and seek to exploit job seekers.

Please note that all email communications from Solventum regarding job opportunities with the company will be from an email with a domain of @solventum.com. Be wary of unsolicited emails or messages regarding Solventum job opportunities from emails with other email domains.

Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

Solventum Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement

Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at Solventum are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.

Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the

terms.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

BNP Paribas Group is the top bank in the European Union and a major international banking establishment. It has close to 185,000 employees in 65 countries. In Spain we are more than 5,100 employees within 13 business lines.




Spain IT Production




Spain IT Production organization consists of CIB ITO & ITG IT Platforms and is responsible for providing IT Production services to our Clients in EMEA, ensuring a Digital Market evolution, in a secured and performant environment, and with a reliable quality. IT Production organisation includes Infrastructure services, Telecom & Workspace, Production Security and Application Production domains and associated transversal services (CTO Office, Control Tower, PMO and IT Continuity). In Spain, IT Production relies on a Platform with over 400 experts that provide full-stack support services ensuring a secure, stable, standardized, and efficient production.




ABOUT THE JOB




MISSION




For the Security Dashboard activities, we are looking for Data Security & Business Intelligence Engineer to support and coordinate the deployment of the Security Dashboard within the security productions of the BNPPARIBAS group




RESPONSIBILITIES




¬∑ Needs analysis for evolution of the current BI solution

¬∑ Provision of solutions in accordance with the company‚Äôs strategy based on (Cyber security Group requirements

¬∑ Coordinate the redesign and Dashboard transformation

¬∑ Deploy the solution within the group‚Äôs ProdSec entities of the group

¬∑ Ensure comitology with stakeholders (Technical Experts, Functional Experts, Product Owner, and customers.)

¬∑ Report to the manager and Team lead on the achievements progress.

¬∑ Ensuring the updating of the documentary heritage corpus




REQUIREMENTS




Studies




Bachelor‚Äôs in computer science or equivalent




Experience




Minimum 5 to 10 years of experience in cybersecurity and production environments




Languages




Fluent English written and spoken. Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communications skills.

French speaking is a plus.




SKILLS




Technical




o PowerBI, SQL, MS SSIS/ SSAS/ SSRS

o Python, PHP/ Symfony

o Systems: architecture, security, etc. to support monitoring and steering actions- d√©finition, production et mise en place de KPI de pilotage et de suivi

o The methodology for monitoring Cybersecurity Control Projects;

o Vulnerability & Patch Management

o Qualys, Tanium is plus




Transversal & Behavioral




o Strong situational analysis and needs identification.

o Proposal force for the most relevant solutions

o Ability to collaborate with different types of profiles. Technical, Functional, Project Leadership. Team leader, etc.

o Ability to share and transmit.

o Rigor, organization and method with a spirit of analysis and synthesis

o Customer orientation: listening, support and understanding of needs.

o Transverse vision to anticipate data correlations / Impacts.

o Good Cyber Security Culture.




BENEFITS

‚Ä¢ Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.

‚Ä¢ Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).

‚Ä¢ Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.

‚Ä¢ Flexible compensation plan.

‚Ä¢ Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).

‚Ä¢ 31 vacation days.







Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Finsolutia intends to reinforce its Information Technology (IT) team with a Data Analyst (M/F).

We are looking for talented and self-motivated individuals for a broad and interesting role working as part of a team based in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Design and develop Microsoft Power BI reports and Dashboards (Operational, Strategic & Analytical) including data set ingestion and transformation, Data Modeling, Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) using the appropriate report templates depicting status of key performance indicators (KPIs) and other important business metrics for an organization to make data driven decisions
Work with cross-functional teams to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs
Build data models, technical and functional documentation with business partners
Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements;
Writing optimized SQL queries for integration with other applications
Designing database tables and related objects;
Transition developed reports and dashboards to interactive/automated dashboards using Power BI
Use T-SQL to develop and implement procedures and functions;
Provide support as required to ensure the availability and optimal performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal users
Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes
Extract and analyze data using PowerQuery, PivotTables, MS Excel, Power BI and DAX.
Design, develop, update, and optimize Power BI dashboards, reports and scorecards to meet business requirements.


Hard Skills


Understanding of T-SQL programming (Microsoft SQL Server )
Knowledge of data modeling following the best practices
2+ years of experience in creating reports, dashboards using Power BI Desktop and Server and maintaining Power BI dashboards on servers.
Understanding of tuning of Power BI reports, data sets, and SQL to deliver maximum report performance.
Experience with ETL Processes Experience with Python and C# (nice to have)
Fluent in English


Soft Skills


Proactivity and constant technological evolution;
Team work and result oriented;
Good communication and interpersonal / facilitation skills.

Our commitment is to ensure an inclusive environment and equal opportunities for all candidates.

Title: Analyst, Advanced Data & Insights
Description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

Job Description

The Global Business Optimisation (GBO) team mission, as part of the Client Services (CS) organization, is to turn massive amounts of data into actionable insights that drive business value while working closely with Visa‚Äôs stakeholders to build creative solutions. Our Advance Data Analytics and Insights analysts are experts in data, coding, payment processing (including authorization and authentication), and creative thinking. We couple in-depth analysis of cardholder behaviour with Visa‚Äôs world-class products to address meaningful business problems.

In this role the analyst interprets and manage data to solve complex problems utilizing skills in data extraction, pre-processing, cleaning, visualization, and the use of tools like python, and Tableau. They are actively involved with all other teams in CS, supporting and developing new insights that help create, manage, and deliver actionable insights to both internal and external stakeholders.

Specific activities may include:


Data extraction: using your payment knowledge you will be responsible for extracting the correct data from numerous databases.
Data cleaning: perform data preprocessing, including cleaning and transforming data into usable information.
Data analysis: apply payments knowledge to interpret data and generate actionable insights.
Data validation: validate data extracted by you and others in the team to control data quality/ reliability.
Data visualization: develop visualizations to make complex analyses accessible to a broad audience.
Provide analytical and support about platforms, tools and data to internal stakeholders including delivering SME training.
Maintain highly strategic reports.
Work with a pan-European team and contribute to local and global projects across Visa.
Work in a Big Data environment with its technical challenges.
Be an out-of-the-box thinker who is passionate about brainstorming and implementing innovative ways to use our unique data to answer business problems.
Keen interest in working with a team of expert‚Äôs data analysts to create Advance Analytics, e.g.: training and deploying Machine Learning models, developing statistical analysis, etc.


This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.

Qualifications

A genuine passion for data, and about the payment‚Äôs ecosystem.

Intermediate to advance level skills in using data analysis tools and software. Excel, SQL, Python, and Tableau.

Proficient in all MS Office applications.

Confidence working in a high pace and dynamic environment, following several

work streams at the same time.

Experience in a corporate environment with data-based decision-making or quantitative analysis.

Ability to turn complex data subjects into easily understandable concepts.

Desirable

Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal skills (fluency in English is required while knowledge of an additional European language is a plus).

Experience of creating business value from data.

Knowledge of authorisation and/ or authentication processing.

Additional Information

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

MSX International Group‚ÄØis the leading global provider of outsourced business solutions for the automotive industry making business in more than 80 countries. MSXI‚Äôs deep industry expertise combined with advanced data analytics and custom software solutions improve the performance of automotive dealership networks by increasing revenue, reducing cost, and enhancing customer satisfaction.

Job Description

As Data Analyst the primary responsibility of this role will be manage and track requests related to lead management, IT reporting, and data analysis, acting as the key contact between different stakeholders, internal and externally.

Key Tasks


Manage and track requests made to external provider / system providers for Lead management, IT reporting topics, and data analysis.
Serve as a point of contact between the different stakeholders.
Coordinate the development and implementation of new solutions required by both the external and internal client with the provider.
Review lead numbers reflected in reporting platforms and ensure those figures accurately match reality.
Propose solutions to help correct errors in data reporting.
Participate in the development of solutions with AI functionalities, e.g., chatbots, knowledge database.


Qualifications


You possess a degree in a relevant field such as: IT, Computer Science, Information System, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Business Analytics or related fields.
Experience with Data & Integration.
Knowledge and experience about AI tools, predictions, statistics.
Experience with html.
You have a good level of English at least C1 is required.
You have strong interpersonal skills, you are open minded, you enjoy working in a Team environment and you possess excellent communication skills and excellent analytical skills.
You are proficient in MS Office365 applications.


Additional Information

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Title: Data Analyst & Reporting Specialist - Data Science (Openbank)
Description:
Country: Spain

Join Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, where innovation meets opportunity! With over 2 million customers across Spain, Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal, we're leading the way in digital banking. From loans and mortgages to a cutting-edge, fully automated investment platform, our products are transforming the industry.

At Openbank, we pride ourselves on simplicity, agility, and security, earning us the title of the most recommended Spanish bank among our customers. Technology is in our DNA and we are constantly developing new digital solutions and products. And we're not stopping there! At Openbank we are proud to be a bank that is gaining more and more international presence, we have just landed in the United States and Mexico.

If you're passionate about digital innovation, eager to make an impact, and ready to be part of a dynamic and forward-thinking company, then we want to hear from you! Join us and be part of our journey to redefine banking for the digital age!

Mission & Role:

In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and extracting insights from large datasets from various sources in our AWS Datalake, to solve complex business problems. You will work closely with data engineers to implement scalable solutions and ensure that the data you work with is clean and reliable. You will be expected to create actionable results through statistical analysis, data visualization, and software development, enabling decision-making across different teams. You will also play a key role in supporting the team‚Äôs efforts to use data more effectively and to automate key business processes.

You will work in a transparent environment where knowledge-sharing and open communication are encouraged. As a team player, you‚Äôll engage with others to reach common goals, making sure to balance both the big picture and fine details.

You will apply your knowledge of statistical analysis and experience with tools like Python or Spark to implement solutions and provide clear insights. Additionally, you will help design and produce efficient data pipelines, contributing to the success of the team and its projects.

To be successful in the role you must bring:


At least +3 years of experience in Statistical Analysis: Strong knowledge of basic statistical concepts and the ability to implement them in programming languages such as Python or Spark. You know when to use different statistical indicators and have experience summarizing insights from data.
Experience with Large Datasets: Familiarity with working on large datasets and implementing scalable solutions. You understand data cleaning, and you know how to collaborate effectively with data engineers.
Problem-Solving with Data: Ability to break down complex problems into manageable analytical components and reuse existing solutions from previous projects.
Software Development Knowledge: Understanding of software development practices, including using Git, writing and testing your code, and leveraging it to produce meaningful results. If you're an open-source enthusiast, we'd love to see your GitHub contributions!
Proficiency in Data Visualization: Experience with tools like ggplot, matplotlib, Tableau, or similar. Bonus points for experience with Microstrategy or QuickSight.
SQL Expertise: You are an SQL ninja, and writing both exploratory and efficient queries is second nature to you.
STEM Background: A degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) is highly desired due to the strong software development component of the role.
You can give and take criticism well. You don‚Äôt get defensive when your ideas are challenged, and you‚Äôre polite enough to challenge others‚Äô ideas when necessary.
Confidence without arrogance: You are confident but not arrogant. You ask for help when needed and openly admit when you don‚Äôt know something. You value and celebrate the contributions of others.
Exceptional communication skills: You explain your ideas clearly and succinctly, ask for input, and listen carefully. You build on the ideas of others, and your presentations are impactful without being overwhelming.
Transparency: You value transparency, always willing to share your knowledge and ideas with the team.
Team collaboration: You are a strong team player, supporting and collaborating with others to achieve common goals.


What do we offer?


Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.


Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Openbank is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered as equal without paying attention to gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age, political orientation, union membership nor disability status.

We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify, and build.

The personal data you provide as well as any data generated during the selection process are confidential and will be processed by Open Bank, S.A./ Open Digital Services, S.L. with registered office at Plaza de Santa B√°rbara 2, 28004 (Madrid), for the sole purpose of managing your participation in the selection processes and, where appropriate, to formalise your recruitment.‚ÄØ

For further information about your rights and data protection, please read the ODS/Openbank Privacy Policy applicable to this type of data processing here.‚ÄØ

At Openbank, we pride ourselves on simplicity, agility, and security, earning us the title of the most recommended Spanish bank among our customers. Technology is in our DNA and we are constantly developing new digital solutions and products. And we're not stopping there! At Openbank we are proud to be a bank that is gaining more and more international presence, we have just landed in the United States and Mexico.

If you're passionate about digital innovation, eager to make an impact, and ready to be part of a dynamic and forward-thinking company, then we want to hear from you! Join us and be part of our journey to redefine banking for the digital age!

Mission & Role:

In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and extracting insights from large datasets from various sources in our AWS Datalake, to solve complex business problems. You will work closely with data engineers to implement scalable solutions and ensure that the data you work with is clean and reliable. You will be expected to create actionable results through statistical analysis, data visualization, and software development, enabling decision-making across different teams. You will also play a key role in supporting the team‚Äôs efforts to use data more effectively and to automate key business processes.

You will work in a transparent environment where knowledge-sharing and open communication are encouraged. As a team player, you‚Äôll engage with others to reach common goals, making sure to balance both the big picture and fine details.

You will apply your knowledge of statistical analysis and experience with tools like Python or Spark to implement solutions and provide clear insights. Additionally, you will help design and produce efficient data pipelines, contributing to the success of the team and its projects.

To be successful in the role you must bring:

  • At least +3 years of experience in Statistical Analysis: Strong knowledge of basic statistical concepts and the ability to implement them in programming languages such as Python or Spark. You know when to use different statistical indicators and have experience summarizing insights from data.
  • Experience with Large Datasets: Familiarity with working on large datasets and implementing scalable solutions. You understand data cleaning, and you know how to collaborate effectively with data engineers.
  • Problem-Solving with Data: Ability to break down complex problems into manageable analytical components and reuse existing solutions from previous projects.
  • Software Development Knowledge: Understanding of software development practices, including using Git, writing and testing your code, and leveraging it to produce meaningful results. If you're an open-source enthusiast, we'd love to see your GitHub contributions!
  • Proficiency in Data Visualization: Experience with tools like ggplot, matplotlib, Tableau, or similar. Bonus points for experience with Microstrategy or QuickSight.
  • SQL Expertise: You are an SQL ninja, and writing both exploratory and efficient queries is second nature to you.
  • STEM Background: A degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) is highly desired due to the strong software development component of the role.
  • You can give and take criticism well. You don‚Äôt get defensive when your ideas are challenged, and you‚Äôre polite enough to challenge others‚Äô ideas when necessary.
  • Confidence without arrogance: You are confident but not arrogant. You ask for help when needed and openly admit when you don‚Äôt know something. You value and celebrate the contributions of others.
  • Exceptional communication skills: You explain your ideas clearly and succinctly, ask for input, and listen carefully. You build on the ideas of others, and your presentations are impactful without being overwhelming.
  • Transparency: You value transparency, always willing to share your knowledge and ideas with the team.
  • Team collaboration: You are a strong team player, supporting and collaborating with others to achieve common goals.

What do we offer?

  • Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
  • Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
  • Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
  • Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
  • Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
  • Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.

Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Openbank is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered as equal without paying attention to gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age, political orientation, union membership nor disability status.

We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify, and build.

The personal data you provide as well as any data generated during the selection process are confidential and will be processed by Open Bank, S.A./ Open Digital Services, S.L. with registered office at Plaza de Santa B√°rbara 2, 28004 (Madrid), for the sole purpose of managing your participation in the selection processes and, where appropriate, to formalise your recruitment.‚ÄØ

For further information about your rights and data protection, please read the ODS/Openbank Privacy Policy applicable to this type of data processing here.‚ÄØ

#OPENBANK

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values


Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action


Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Wood Mackenzie‚Äôs Power and Renewables Data team.

This role will focus on the analysis, programmatic acquisition, and preparation of data for delivery to our customers and research teams.

Wood Mackenzie Produces Research And Data That The Energy Industry Relies On To Understand And Navigate The Energy Transition. Examples Of Products That You Will Contribute To Include


Power supply and demand long-term outlooks
Power market pricing history and long-term outlooks
Renewable technology supplier leaderboards


Responsibilities


Own the quality and delivery timeline of critical datasets
Obtain, transform, and deliver information from our databases to support industry analysis using Excel, PowerQuery, PowerBI, GraphQL, SQL, Sisense, Python, and Snowflake
Create and maintain workflows for internal stakeholders
Create and maintain data pipelines to feed customer facing products
Identify and assess opportunities for optimization of our systems, processes, and datasets
Monitor and resolve alerts in production environments to preserve the integrity of our products
Identify internal and external sources of data that will support customer needs
Collaborate with colleagues across multiple time zones and disciplines to uncover pain points, process improvements, and product requirements


About You


At least 2 years of experience in a data analyst or data engineering role
Experience working in environments reliant on SQL, Python, and Snowflake
Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration
Hands on approach to problem solving that delves into the details while maintaining the ability to succinctly propose solutions to steer management decisions
Independently completes projects given time and platform constraints
Desire to play a key role in the energy transition by delivering the data and research that catalyzes progress
Intellectual curiosity about the provenance of data and journey it makes to arrive at a destination
Passionate ownership of projects and excitement to share accomplishments with fellow Woodmackers
Preferred: Experience in the energy industry or power modelling domain
Fluent in English. Bonus language skills: Mandarin, Spanish


Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Veeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead.

At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We're not just any public company ‚Äì we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors.

As a Work Anywhere company, we support your flexibility to work from home or in the office, so you can thrive in your ideal environment.

Join us in transforming the life sciences industry, committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.

The Role

Veeva Link‚Äôs vision is to become the global leader for deep data in life sciences. We are looking for a detail-oriented and experienced Data Analyst to join our product team.

In this role, you will play a key part in developing and implementing a data governance framework, ensuring data accuracy, completeness, and integrity. Your main responsibilities include establishing data quality monitoring processes, identifying root causes of inconsistencies, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to resolve data gaps.

To thrive in this role, you need expertise in SQL and Python for data manipulation and automation. You should be comfortable working with large datasets, designing dashboards with actionable recommendations, and applying statistical techniques to assess and enhance data quality.

The ideal candidate has experience in creating documentation (process documentation, data collection guidelines) and in contributing to data governance policies and best practices.

What You'll Do


Implement a data governance framework
Establish and maintain robust processes for tracking and assessing data quality
Develop automated checks to proactively detect data inconsistencies
Apply statistical techniques to enhance data quality
Create customized reports and dashboards
Extract data from databases (e.g., Redshift, MongoDB)
Identify and resolve root causes of quality issues
Collaborate in cross-functional teams of product managers, engineering, and operations
Create and maintain documentation


Requirements


3+ years of work experience in data analysis or data quality role
Strong technical skills in data analysis, with proficiency in SQL and Python
Experience in data storage and processing on cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure
Strong problem-solving skills and experience working with cross-functional teams
Experience writing process documentation and data collection guidelines


Nice to Have


University degree in medicine or life sciences
Understanding of healthcare, life sciences, or pharmaceutical industry data
Experience with data visualization tools to create dashboards and reports
Understanding of data engineering concepts (ETL, data pipelines)
Experience with workflow automation tools such as Apache Airflow
Experience working in an Agile or product-driven environment
Familiarity with data privacy and compliance regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA)


Perks & Benefits


1% charitable giving program
Medical private insurance
Private pension plan
Life insurance
Fitness reimbursement


#RemoteSpain

Veeva‚Äôs headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.

As an equal opportunity employer, Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us at talent_accommodations@veeva.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for the next challenge in your career? Would you like to be part of an exciting, highly qualified team of professionals in an international environment?




We are currently looking for a qualified Data Analyst.




Join an international division and work alongside some of the most talented engineers and technicians from all over the world.

Travel abroad with your project.
Specialized training and continuous professional development.
Social benefits and flexible compensation plan.




Responsibilities:




Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Develop and maintain data models, reports, and dashboards to support business decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights.
Ensure data quality and integrity by performing regular data validation and cleansing.

Participate in the deployment of data solutions, all the way to production.
Ensure the quality of data analysis and reporting based on transparent metrics.

Requirements:




Minimum 3-5 years of experience in data analysis.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and working with Gitlab.
Experience working with Docker, Kubernetes, and microservices architectures is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.




We positively value all work or study experience abroad.

All positions require a high level of English (at least B2) - please send your detailed CV in English.

Title: Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
Job Description




This position will support the development and implementation of the business partnering function to facilitate and develop actionable recommendations based on business insights that address key business needs and objectives. In collaboration with the rest of the Business Intelligence function they will support insight and information delivery across the organization. This includes but is not limited to developing data models and dashboards in the BI Platform to support all business stakeholders. This position will report to the BI Business Partners and will work closely with the key members of the business areas.




Location: This role is based in Madrid, Spain




Responsibilities




Design and implement a Data Analytics Framework to ensure a common and homogeneous analytics practice across the organisation in alignment with the global IT Strategy.
Report implementation - Create and maintain required BI reports and dashboards; improve data quality & automatization; prototype new reports and BI solutions.
Insights creation and delivery to end-users. Strong drive for actionable data.
Will support the BI Business Partner in their duties and ad-hoc analysis.
Accountable of the correct implementation of corporate BI strategy.
Provides coaching and training for end-users regarding the BI tools.




Qualifications




Minimum 2 ‚Äì 3 years‚Äô experience.
Extensive experience of developing reports in Power BI as well as other Microsoft Power Platform applications.
Knowledge of database concepts and relational databases (e.g. Azure Synapse, MySQL, SQL Server) and data exploitation technics.
Analytics background with experience in predictive model and machine learning in Microsoft stack is an advantage.
Ability to deliver tactical solutions while managing different issues.
Experience in data management projects (end-to-end information delivery with data warehousing, data modeling, data integration, data profiling, advance analytics and business).
Experience with business intelligence project related to information lifecycle.
Organized & effective - take a well-ordered, structured approached in task management.
Strong influencing and communication skills.
Critical thinker ‚Äì ability to understand the logical connections between ideas, identify, construct and evaluate arguments.
Think Strategically - foresee and take action to deal with problems and opportunities.
Change Management - be an advocate for positive change and improvements.




Additional Information




Our commitment to being a remarkable workplace mirrors our commitment to delivering Memorable Moments. Joining RHG comes with a range of perks:

Special rates for team members, their friends, and family at our hotels.
Tailored development opportunities for everyone at all levels and all roles .
A meaningful employment contributing to shared value, a better future, and a sustainable planet.
Local benefits apply.




Ready to say, 'Yes I Can!'? Join us in making every moment matter.




Skills

Azure Synapse, MySQL, SQL Server

Title: Insights Analyst - Temporary
Description:
With two centuries of family heritage, Suntory Global Spirits is a world leader in premium spirits. As a truly global business, we bring together the best of our culturally diverse heritage. We value both agility and long-term thinking; we share a collective commitment to excellence and a dedication to craftsmanship. Across borders and roles, we collaborate to delight our consumers responsibly whilst contributing to a more sustainable society for all our stakeholders.




Our Vision is Growing for Good, and our mission is to be the world‚Äôs most admired, fastest-growing premium spirits company. We‚Äôre a business that runs on responsibility, integrity, ambition and drive, and we celebrate exceptional performance. We welcome our people to dream big and tenaciously pursue ambitious goals ‚Äì we call it our Yatte Minahare Spirit.







Insights Analyst (Temporary)

This role is open in Madrid, Spain.







What makes this a great opportunity?

The Insights Analyst skillfully creates appropriate methodologies, execute primary research (quantitative and qualitative), to vividly bring alive consumer understanding / insight that inspires big ideas and delivers profitable brand growth. Equip the marketing/trade teams with an understanding of their performance. Bring the consumer to life as part of the activity development process (e.g. creative briefing) and is a key contributor to the Consumer Planning & Insights team, looking for ‚ÄúSimpler, Faster, Better‚Äù ways to deliver value to the business.







Role Responsibilities

Consumer understanding: Delivering the learning plan for the brand. Accountable for identifying and driving the brand consumer agenda. Conducts insights and research for Spain Market: qualitative fieldwork and quantitative studies; running projects end-to-end (many times with minimal supervision). Support the day-to-day project management needs across a wide variety of research methodologies and suppliers.
Category & brand strategy and activity planning: Leads, in partnership with the marketing team, a robust situation assessment for the Brand as input into the annual strategy process and activity planning. Provide day-to-day consumer insights and business intelligence consulting support for brand and sales team members. Ensuring the brand / trade teams understand consumer reasons for performance (using tracker, sales data, trends data etc), and act on the implications of that understanding.
Integrated brand communication: Supports the development of creative and media briefing process alongside the brand and agency partners. Ensures that the consumer programs and creative assets are informed by the most current and relevant Insights and testing protocols.
Insights & resource management: Responsible for designing and executing consumer and market research in connection with the marketing teams to: identify emerging consumer behaviors, wants, and needs; new consumer segments (now, next and future); market trends (micro, macro and mega), and analyzing competitive activity. Partner with local data and key platform providers (e.g. Nielsen) for brand/market -specific projects as needed ‚Äì as well as leveraging the global insight tools, platforms and data, where possible. Accountable for managing brand research spend to deliver targeted savings and on budget Ensures that the consumer programs and creative assets are informed by the most current and relevant Insights and testing protocols.
Business performance management: Builds an extensive understanding of Measure & Evaluation for the brand to drive more effective marketing planning. Integration of CMI sources in to Quarterly/Monthly Business Reviews. Management of relationship and day to day interaction with external partners (Nielsen, etc...). Responsible for training new users and the ongoing capability building for users in CMI tools (Nielsen, Answers, Clickview, Kantar)







Qualifications

5+ years of experience of commercial/ business analytics with strong application experience (Client Side)
Bachelor‚Äôs degree (Masters preferred) in Business Analytics, Data Science, Applied Mathematics / Statistics /Computer Science
Proven experience in synthesizing and driving business impact utilizing information from multiple disparate sources (including but not limited to Nielsen NIQ data, distributor data, first-party retailer data)
Passionate about Consumer Insights, data and Market trends
Analytical and strategic mindset to think about the near- and longer-term team and evolution of analytics capabilities
Proficiency visualization tools / BI / analytics tools (e.g., Excel, Power BI) is required
Strong communication and presentation skills with proven track record of using insights to influence executive sand colleagues to action
Ability to work independently and strong sense of individual accountability. Works with fair level of autonomy, is able to prioritize, but knows when to escalate problems
High degree of numeracy and analysis
Experience of managing multiple projects simultaneously / multi-tasking .
Industry experience in AlcBev is a plus







At SGS, people are our number one priority! We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive environment. All recruitment and hiring decisions are based on an applicant‚Äôs skills and experience.

  • High degree of numeracy and analysis
  • Experience of managing multiple projects simultaneously / multi-tasking .
  • Industry experience in AlcBev is a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values


Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action


Role Purpose

The Data Analyst will play a key role in advancing forecasting and modelling efforts by managing, analysing, and optimising large datasets across renewable, conventional, and storage assets globally. Working on asset revenue forecasting, power dispatch modelling, or power markets data, the analyst will focus on automating workflows, ensuring data quality, and delivering actionable insights through close collaboration with research, engineering, and product teams. This role contributes directly to improving forecasting accuracy and enhancing the company's global asset performance and revenue strategies.

Responsibilities

Knowledge


Structures poorly defined problems, gathers feedback, and solves them effectively.
Defines hypotheses and appropriate analysis approaches.
Ensures statistical validity of results while avoiding common pitfalls.
Develops deep technical expertise and emerging domain knowledge in forecasting or dispatch modelling.
Provides specialist skills in data analysis, visualisation, and data management.
Fully understands the technical data landscape within the energy domain.
Maintains a growth mindset, continually evolving their skills.


Impact


Performs defined and repeatable tasks with limited guidance.
Independently formulates new analyses and project components.
Carries out independent analysis on specific areas of forecasting or modelling projects.
Delivers high-quality outputs on time, recognised for accuracy and reliability.
Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL or Python for data handling.


Collaboration


Supports data governance and quality assurance activities.
Engages directly with stakeholders, building confidence in data-driven outcomes.
Works closely with peers in Research, Product, Data, Data Engineering, and other business functions.


Innovation


Identifies opportunities for efficiency, optimisation, or new data creation within their focus area.
Uses technical and domain knowledge to create new value and insights.


Specialisms

General


Owns and manages data within their role or team focus.
Leverages specialist toolsets or domain expertise for data analysis and decision-making.


Data Modelling


Applies best practices in data modelling to support use cases.
Translates data requirements into effective data structures.
Collaborates with engineers to enhance data modelling capabilities for large-scale datasets.


Key Expectations

Experience & Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
2‚Äì4 years of experience in data analysis, including handling large, complex datasets.
Advanced SQL skills for querying and managing relational databases.
Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Sisense, Power BI, Streamlit).


Technical Skills


Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration.
Understanding of statistical methods and data modelling techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms like Snowflake is advantageous.
Knowledge of data governance frameworks and data security protocols.


Soft Skills


Exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving capabilities.
Strong communication skills, able to translate complex insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborative mindset with a commitment to continuous learning and staying updated on energy sector trends.


Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

  • Owns and manages data within their role or team focus.
  • Leverages specialist toolsets or domain expertise for data analysis and decision-making.

Data Modelling

  • Applies best practices in data modelling to support use cases.
  • Translates data requirements into effective data structures.
  • Collaborates with engineers to enhance data modelling capabilities for large-scale datasets.

Key Expectations

Experience & Qualifications

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • 2‚Äì4 years of experience in data analysis, including handling large, complex datasets.
  • Advanced SQL skills for querying and managing relational databases.
  • Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Sisense, Power BI, Streamlit).

Technical Skills

  • Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration.
  • Understanding of statistical methods and data modelling techniques.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms like Snowflake is advantageous.
  • Knowledge of data governance frameworks and data security protocols.

Soft Skills

  • Exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving capabilities.
  • Strong communication skills, able to translate complex insights for non-technical stakeholders.
  • Collaborative mindset with a commitment to continuous learning and staying updated on energy sector trends.

Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.
