Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
It‚Äôs an exciting time to join Superbet, we‚Äôre entering new markets, developing new technologies, and moving step by step towards our goal of exciting the world. As our business grows, the number of exciting people initiatives grows with it, and we‚Äôre looking for a new colleague to partner with our team to bring these to life.

Superbet Group spends a multi-million Euro marketing budget in several European markets ‚Äì Romania, Poland, Belgium & Serbia - while actively seeking opportunities to expand into more countries. Measuring the success of marketing is a challenge. Increasingly difficult as data & gambling regulations change at pace, and especially difficult in our industry where the sports calendar and customer value are extremely varied.

The marketing insights team builds the tools and understanding we use to optimize our marketing investment across multiple marketing channels. This role will focus on supporting the marketing team to measure the impact of marketing through data analysis, experimentation and reporting.

We're looking for someone who has experience in the following areas:


Track record of driving business impact with data. You‚Äôre comfortable taking data work all the way to real world recommendations.
Experience in designing and executing an end-to-end data project, from working out what to measure, to building reporting and pipelines, to extracting and sharing insight.
Ability to communicate to senior stakeholders and operational teams.
Comfortable getting into detail without losing track of the big picture.
Functional/Technical skills across the data spectrum:
Comfortable in SQL, spreadsheets and slides.
An understanding of how tracking works both for web and apps
Experience designing and analysing ad effectiveness studies using causal inference and statistical techniques to understand the impact of marketing strategies across the media mix
Experience with dashboard building
Experience with building learning agendas, and experiments that drive performance improvements and uncover best practices

Bonus points if you have:


Comfortable building and maintaining data pipelines
History of working with marketing teams
Knowledge of a scripting language (such as Python or R)
Familiarity with dbt, dataform or other data modeling tool
Knowledge of tracking setup (such as Google Tag Manager)
Expertise in Statistics, Machine Learning and/or Econometrics
Experience with app marketing and/or tracking for apps
Experience in online sports betting or gambling
Familiarity with online marketing via Google Ads, Meta, etc..


What you'll be doing?


Build and maintain self-service reporting
Build and maintain dashboards and reports for use by marketing teams
Monitor data pipelines to ensure data is available and accurate
Ensure that tracking is set up correctly
Analysis and insight
Take on deep dive projects to dig into performance issues or opportunities.
Run analysis to understand root causes of changes in the data/user trends.
Share your findings in engaging ways through data storytelling.
Support Experimentation
Work with marketing teams to design experiments that will give clear guidance on the right approach.
Interpret experiment results.
Forecasting and modeling
Build models to estimate marketing effectiveness
Build models to predict likely long term outcomes from current information
Segment users to help with targeting of marketing campaigns

About Superbet Group

Superbet is a global tech and entertainment company committed to delivering thrilling, technology-driven, sports betting and gaming experiences to millions of customers worldwide. Established in 2008, in Romania, the Group operates in over 12 countries, with key markets in Romania, Belgium, Poland, Serbia, and Brazil.

Superbet‚Äôs ambitious growth strategy currently focuses on expanding across Europe and Latin America while delivering immersive customer experiences and redefining ways to connect with its audience. Across international markets, the Group‚Äôs global expansion strategy is driven by innovation, responsible technology, and a passion for supporting iconic sports clubs and athletes.

Global Recognition and Standards

In 2019, Blackstone Inc., the world‚Äôs largest private equity firm, recognized Superbet‚Äôs vision and achievements with a strategic minority investment of ‚Ç¨175 million. In 2025, the company further strengthened its financial position through a 1.3 billion Euro refinancing agreement, reinforcing its partnerships with Blackstone and certain funds and accounts managed by HPS Investment Partners, paving the way for an accelerated global growth.

As a leader in compliance and best practices, Superbet Group is an active member of the International Betting Integrity Association (IBIA) and the European Betting & Gaming Association (EGBA).

  • Comfortable building and maintaining data pipelines
  • History of working with marketing teams
  • Knowledge of a scripting language (such as Python or R)
  • Familiarity with dbt, dataform or other data modeling tool
  • Knowledge of tracking setup (such as Google Tag Manager)
  • Expertise in Statistics, Machine Learning and/or Econometrics
  • Experience with app marketing and/or tracking for apps
  • Experience in online sports betting or gambling
  • Familiarity with online marketing via Google Ads, Meta, etc..

What you'll be doing?

  • Build and maintain self-service reporting
  • Build and maintain dashboards and reports for use by marketing teams
  • Monitor data pipelines to ensure data is available and accurate
  • Ensure that tracking is set up correctly
  • Analysis and insight
  • Take on deep dive projects to dig into performance issues or opportunities.
  • Run analysis to understand root causes of changes in the data/user trends.
  • Share your findings in engaging ways through data storytelling.
  • Support Experimentation
    • Work with marketing teams to design experiments that will give clear guidance on the right approach.
    • Interpret experiment results.
    • Forecasting and modeling
      • Build models to estimate marketing effectiveness
      • Build models to predict likely long term outcomes from current information
      • Segment users to help with targeting of marketing campaigns
    About Superbet Group

    Superbet is a global tech and entertainment company committed to delivering thrilling, technology-driven, sports betting and gaming experiences to millions of customers worldwide. Established in 2008, in Romania, the Group operates in over 12 countries, with key markets in Romania, Belgium, Poland, Serbia, and Brazil.

    Superbet‚Äôs ambitious growth strategy currently focuses on expanding across Europe and Latin America while delivering immersive customer experiences and redefining ways to connect with its audience. Across international markets, the Group‚Äôs global expansion strategy is driven by innovation, responsible technology, and a passion for supporting iconic sports clubs and athletes.

    Global Recognition and Standards

    In 2019, Blackstone Inc., the world‚Äôs largest private equity firm, recognized Superbet‚Äôs vision and achievements with a strategic minority investment of ‚Ç¨175 million. In 2025, the company further strengthened its financial position through a 1.3 billion Euro refinancing agreement, reinforcing its partnerships with Blackstone and certain funds and accounts managed by HPS Investment Partners, paving the way for an accelerated global growth.

    As a leader in compliance and best practices, Superbet Group is an active member of the International Betting Integrity Association (IBIA) and the European Betting & Gaming Association (EGBA).

Title: Data analyst - (Remote - Europe/EU)
Description:
Jobgether has ALL remote jobs globally. We match you to roles where you're most likely to succeed, and provide feedback on every application to help you learn. No more guesswork, application black holes, or recruiter ghosting in your job search.

For one of our clients, we are looking for a Data Analyst (Monochains, Multinetwork, and Cosmos Hub Ecosystem), remotely from Europe.

In this role, you will work with a dynamic and innovative team focused on exploring blockchain ecosystems to identify opportunities and risks. Your responsibilities will involve developing end-to-end data solutions, from initial analysis to deployment, with a strong focus on optimization, scalability, and performance. You'll provide valuable insights to the team and community through informative dashboards, while also improving validation processes and working closely with the data engineering team. This is a fantastic opportunity to shape the future of decentralized finance with cutting-edge technologies.

Accountabilities:


Explore blockchain ecosystems, identifying potential opportunities and risks related to Monochains, Multinetwork, and Cosmos Hub
Design and develop comprehensive data solutions, from analysis to deployment, ensuring performance optimization and scalability
Build and maintain informative dashboards for internal teams, the company, and the wider community
Collaborate with data engineering teams to define data requirements, and ensure proper granularity, frequency, and data quality
Manage and govern team data marts, ensuring data lineage and providing actionable insights
Provide ad-hoc support to team members to address emerging data needs



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
Proficiency in advanced SQL (including joins and window expressions) and experience with Google BigQuery
Competence in analytical programming languages such as Python, with experience in the analytical stack
Experience with ETL tools like Airflow and dbt
Advanced knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Superset, Looker)
Strong skills in data research, probability theory, and mathematical statistics, including regressions and A/B testing
Proven ability to tell compelling data stories and present your analysis with clear insights
Familiarity with cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology is a plus
Proficiency in English (B2+ or higher)



Benefits


Competitive salary, with the option to receive payments in cryptocurrency
Well-being program and mental health care support
Compensation for educational programs, including foreign language courses and professional development
Reimbursement for equipment and co-working spaces
Opportunities to attend overseas conferences and engage with the global community
Positive, friendly, and collaborative communication culture
P2P.org is an equal opportunity employer, offering a diverse and inclusive work environment

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Senior Data Analyst plays a crucial role in consolidating, analyzing, and optimizing operational and financial reporting across multiple countries. This role ensures accurate data insights for process improvements and acts as a bridge between IT and operational teams. Additionally, the Senior Analyst serves as a Project Management Office (PMO) coordinator, ensuring smooth project execution and process documentation. The position also involves developing and delivering interactive training sessions to enhance data literacy and process understanding within the organization.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, consolidate, and analyze reports from multiple regions to identify trends and performance gaps.
Develop data visualization dashboards and user-friendly reporting tools to improve decision-making.
Identify key data trends and detect anomalies (red flags), providing corrective action recommendations.
Collaborate with IT to ensure process flows are aligned with system capabilities and automation strategies.
Act as a PMO coordinator, tracking project timelines, milestones, and resource allocations.
Document operational processes, ensuring clear and structured process flows.
Support change management initiatives, driving seamless adoption of new systems and reporting structures.
Design and deliver interactive training sessions to enhance data analytics capabilities across teams.
Conduct workshops and hands-on sessions to ensure proper use of reporting tools and dashboards.
Travel regionally to support teams in implementing new data-driven initiatives and provide on-site training when needed.




Qualifications & Experience:

Degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience in multinational environments, handling regional data reporting and analytics.
Strong expertise in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and Power BI.
Background in project management, process documentation, and training facilitation.
Familiarity with finance, business analysis, or operational performance tracking.
Fluent English required; additional languages are a plus.




Key Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
High proficiency in data visualization and reporting.
Experience in process improvement and workflow optimization.
Strong project management and change management skills.
Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively across different teams and cultures.
Capability to design and conduct training programs, using interactive methodologies to engage learners.
Strong presentation and facilitation skills, ensuring effective knowledge transfer.

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Role Overview

The Reporting Analyst will report to the Sr. Director of Technical Operations and will be responsible for developing, maintaining and publishing PowerBI dashboards and reports for operational metrics. This role involves creating interactive dashboards and reports, analyzing data to provide actionable insights, and ensuring data accuracy and integrity, with a focus on contact center metrics.

This is a Hybrid position located in Frisco, TX. You will be required to be onsite on an as-needed basis, typically 1 to 6 times a month. We are only considering candidates within a commutable distance to one of the two locations and are not offering relocation assistance at this time.

This is a Hybrid position located in Frisco, TX. You will be required to be onsite on an as-needed basis, typically 1 to 6 times a month. We are only considering candidates within a commutable distance to Frisco and are not offering relocation assistance at this time.

About The Role


Develop and maintain interactive PowerBI dashboards and reports to visualize key contact center metrics such as average handle time (AHT), service level (SLA), and customer satisfaction (CSAT).
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and understand business needs for data visualization, ensuring that the visualizations provide valuable insights for contact center operations.
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing regular data validation and quality checks.
Provide ad-hoc reporting, modeling, and analysis to support various business initiatives.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data integrity and optimal performance.
Conduct research and evaluations for new technologies and best practices in data analysis and reporting.
Develop and maintain documentation for reporting processes and business intelligence tools, including technical specifications and user guides.
Monitor and optimize the performance of reporting systems, identifying and addressing any issues or bottlenecks.
Ensure compliance with security and regulatory requirements and implement best practices for data protection and privacy.


About You


You have 5+ years of experience in data analysis and reporting, with a focus on developing and maintaining PowerBI dashboards.
You excel at analyzing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions.
You are proficient in data visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, or similar
You are skilled in ensuring data accuracy and integrity through regular data validation and quality checks.
You possess strong collaboration skills, working effectively with stakeholders across various functions.
You are experienced in providing ad-hoc reporting and analysis to support various business initiatives.


Company Overview

McAfee is a leader in personal security for consumers. Focused on protecting people, not just devices, McAfee consumer solutions adapt to users‚Äô needs in an always online world, empowering them to live securely through integrated, intuitive solutions that protects their families and communities with the right security at the right moment.

Company Benefits And Perks

We work hard to embrace diversity and inclusion and encourage everyone at McAfee to bring their authentic selves to work every day. We offer a variety of social programs, flexible work hours and family-friendly benefits to all of our employees.


Bonus Program
Pension and Retirement Plans
Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage
Paid Time Off
Paid Parental Leave
Support for Community Involvement


We're serious about our commitment to diversity which is why McAfee prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, A national healthcare provider specializing in individualized medication therapy for chronic conditions is actively looking for a seasoned data and analytics professional. This organization focuses on delivering holistic support to patients through tightly integrated care coordination teams, actionable health data, and personalized treatment adherence strategies. Accredited at the highest levels in the pharmacy field, the team works closely with clinical partners to elevate patient care.



Role Overview




This position is ideal for someone who blends technical skill with business insight and thrives in a collaborative, fast-paced setting. Core duties include:


Crafting analytical reports, dashboards, and backend solutions.

Designing and maintaining reliable data pipelines, improving existing integration workflows.

Translating operational requirements into detailed technical blueprints.

Proposing and building predictive models and strategic reporting tools.

Estimating project scope and timelines, leading initiatives using Agile frameworks.

Investigating and resolving issues in reporting logic, database scripts, and process flows.

Working across departments to co-create innovative solutions.

Staying current with new tools, domain-specific language, and shifting organizational needs.

Managing multiple assignments with precision and strong prioritization.

Sharing consistent progress updates with key partners.

Ensuring that all work aligns with regulatory and internal ethical guidelines.

Contributing to specialty pharmacy compliance efforts aligned with major accreditation bodies.


Desired Background



Undergraduate degree in computer science, information technology, statistics, or a similar discipline-or equivalent experience.

At least 3 years of progressive experience in analytics, business intelligence, or related IT roles.

Background in healthcare data or systems is advantageous.


Technical Skills - Preferred



ML Platforms: Familiarity with tools like Azure ML or equivalents.

Databases: Experience with T-SQL, Microsoft SQL, DAX, or similar cloud data environments.

Data Integration: Proficiency with SSIS, Informatica, or cloud-native ETL/ELT services.

Visualization Tools: Skilled in tools such as Power BI, Excel, SSRS, or similar (e.g., Tableau, Looker).

Advanced use of DAX and Power Query for report creation is a plus.

Exposure to version control tools (e.g., Git, DevOps) is helpful.

Understanding of cloud infrastructure (Azure, AWS, GCP) is desirable.


Additional Technical Knowledge



Confident using Microsoft desktop and server environments.

Basic understanding of networks, system security, and hardware configurations.

Proficient in SQL and general database administration.

Relevant Microsoft certifications are beneficial.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
CU Strategic Planning is a 100% employee-owned company on a mission to unlock opportunities for credit unions to change lives and uplift communities. We partner with credit unions of all sizes to increase the impact of their loans and services - helping them better serve their members and deliver meaningful, measurable outcomes.




If you are passionate about purpose-driven work and want to join a collaborative team that's changing the financial landscape one community at a time, we would love to hear from you.




Five Reasons Why You Want To Work With Us

You want to work with a team that is competent, confident, passionate and focused on achieving big goals.
You want to work on a product and deliver services that have the potential to help millions of people.
You want to have a voice and employee ownership.
You want to be part of a fun and healthy work culture.
You want to work at a company that will provide an opportunity to take your career to the next level.




Summary/Objective

We are looking for a mission-driven Data Analyst. In this role, you will play a critical part in supporting grant and certification compliance through data analysis, reporting and client interaction. You will work with internal teams and clients to analyze data, support federal and state grant reporting and help credit unions meet compliance goals that align with their community development mission.




The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, analytical and collaborative - someone who thrives in mission-focused work. You bring strong Excel skills, comfort working with databases and a basic understanding of financial concepts. You are a clear communicator who enjoys digging into data to tell a story and support real-world impact.




Key Responsibilities

Analyze and interpret client loan data to support federal and state CDFI grant and certification reporting.
Review and validate submitted data to ensure accuracy, completeness and compliance with program requirements.
Assist in drafting narratives and reports that demonstrate credit union impact and progress toward grant goals.
Provide thoughtful, knowledgeable support to clients during the reporting process, helping them understand loan tracking and benchmarks.
Collaborate with internal teams to improve data collection, streamline reporting systems and enhance department efficiency.
Contribute to organizational projects by managing data needs, supporting special initiatives and maintaining internal documentation and systems.




Travel

Minimal overnight travel is expected.




Education

Associate or bachelor's degree preferred but not required.
Equivalent experience in data analysis, lending or compliance will also be considered.




Skills & Experience

Strong analytical skills with experience working in Excel and database tools (e.g., Access).
Familiarity with lending concepts, loan types and financial services preferred.
Excellent attention to detail and ability to manage and validate large data sets.
Clear and professional written and verbal communication skills.
Experience supporting grants or compliance reporting is a plus.
Ability to maintain confidentiality and navigate sensitive client data.
Comfort working independently and as part of a collaborative, mission-driven team.
Bonus: Experience with Salesforce, CDFI Fund systems (AMIS/CIMS) or credit union platforms like Symitar or Fiserv.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Gupta Media was founded 20 years ago on the idea that advertising could create huge leverage in our client's business. Our early work was focused on the entertainment industry, specifically live events (Boston Calling, among others) and recorded music (Sony Music, Universal Music & Disney are all clients). We have dramatically grown our work with big brands (Amazon, Fender) and sports brands (LA Galaxy, Washington Commanders). We have a global client base with a growing local roster across B2B and B2C brands across campaign, content and branding assignments.




We are on the hunt for a talented Data Analyst to join our Strategy & Analytics team to assist with reporting, tracking, data analysis, advertising strategy, and visualization needs. In this role, you will work internally to assist paid media analysts with reporting requests as well as externally to provide clients with insights regarding their advertising campaigns.




If you are excited by the opportunity to improve reporting for our clients and our analysts, are able to communicate effectively to understand what tools will help solve a problem, and then work collaboratively to design a solution that‚Äôs scalable, accurate and easy-to-use, we want to talk to you.




Who You Are:

You have a true love for data. You have no problem tearing apart a problem and living inside a spreadsheet or data set to find the answer to any question.
You have advanced knowledge of SQL, Excel, and Google Data Studio/Data Visualization tools, and enjoy working with SQL on a day-to-day basis.
Experience with Marketing APIs, BigQuery or other cloud data warehouse tools (AWS, Snowflake, Databricks), ETL tools (such as Rivery, Looker, Supermetrics), and/or Python is a plus.
You have a bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field and at least 1 year of experience working with marketing data and/or paid advertising campaigns, preferably in a fast-paced agency environment or team structure.

What You‚Äôll Do:




Reporting:

Maintain customized dashboards in Google Sheets and Excel on a daily/weekly cadence.
Use Advanced Excel, SQL, and Google Data Studio/Visualization Tools to generate pivot tables and other visualizations summarizing thousands of lines of data.
Translate performance media metrics into clear, digestible reports for client advertising campaigns.
Communicate insights effectively through Google Slides or PowerPoint decks.




Strategy:

Learn our clients‚Äô businesses and align media strategy with their business goals.
Analyze advertising trends within a single project and across multiple projects to guide media buying strategy.
Apply your background in paid media and/or digital advertising, including understanding concepts like LTV, ROAS, and Incremental Revenue.
Engage in discussions with clients to build trust and gain stakeholder buy-in on media strategy and results.




At Gupta Media, we work hard every day to be better at all that we do ‚Äî and that includes fostering a diverse and inclusive community that encourages and respects a broad range of backgrounds, experiences and ideas. Join us and help us find the next great idea.




Gupta Media is an office-first organization.

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
Please note: We are unable to sponsor work visas or offer employment-based immigration support at this time. Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States without the need for current or future sponsorship.




Job Summary

We are seeking a dynamic and detail-oriented Senior Data Analyst to join our data product management department. You will be responsible for working with the Senior Director of Product Management and the Data Delivery department to analyze large data sets to assess applicability, and design data products to address client opportunities.




Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis:
Perform data cleaning, normalization and aggregation as required to enable your analyses.
Proficient in writing complex SQL queries for both relational (Postgres, Redshift) and NoSql (BigQuery) databases. (NoSql experience not strictly required, but a plus)
Proficient using Excel to fine tune and/or prevent the results of your data analyses.
Operational:
Build presentations and/or dashboards to be used in the sales process with potential clients.
Proactively look for opportunities to sell or improve Ovation data assets based on your deep understanding of the available data.
Work with internal and external stakeholders including product, marketing, engineering, and executive teams to develop collaborative relationships across the organization, and assist with their data requests.




Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Informatics, or Information Systems is preferred.
Data analysis mastery in Excel and/or Google sheets, including pivots, charting, and forecasting.
Excellent analytical skills. An ability to understand and simplify complex data and translate into easy to understand business information suitable for client presentations.
Competent with statistics and statistical distributions
Experience with data visualization and building client-facing documents.
5+ years of experience in a Data Analyst role. (Experience in the biological or healthcare fields is a plus.)




Benefits

Competitive salary
Health, Dental and Vision Insurance
Accident & Critical Illness Insurance
Voluntary Life, AD&D
Long & Short Term Disability
Company paid maternal & paternal leave
Flexible work hours

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Req143890

Position Purpose

A Data Analyst Supply Chain leverages technical abilities to synthesize complex analytical tasks into easily understood data-driven stories. Responsible for working collaboratively with other analysts to apply established analytical processes on diverse datasets to deduce insights and solve real-world business problems. Also ensures that all reporting and analytical responsibilities are completed competently in a timely manner, continually seeking out opportunities to hone existing technical skills (e.g. writing SQL/code, statistics, machine learning, etc.) and learn new skills. Operates under the supervision and mentorship of more experienced managers and data scientists.

Key Responsibilities


30% Executes existing reporting and analytical responsibilities
20% Leverages data analytics tools to create new dashboards, reports, and any additional ad-hoc requests
20% Ensures the quality of work output by displaying a keen attention to detail
20% Develops additional technical competencies and subject matter expertise within core functional group
10% Presents findings in easily understood ways, focuses on how the data analytics fits into the bigger picture


Direct Manager/Direct Reports


This postion reports to Manager
This position has no Direct Reports


Travel Requirements


Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.


Physical Requirements


Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.


Working Conditions


Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.


Minimum Qualifications


Must be eighteen years of age or older.
Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.


Preferred Qualifications


Work experience with SQL Server, Teradata, Oracle, or comparable database systems
1-3 years work experience in data mining, statistical analysis, auditing, and/or forecasting.
Prior direct experience in analyzing the relevant subject matter (e.g. Supply Chain, Merchandising, Operations, etc.)
B.S. in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, Finance or related quantitative field


Minimum Education


The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job.


Preferred Education


No additional education


Minimum Years Of Work Experience


0


Preferred Years Of Work Experience


No additional years of experience


Minimum Leadership Experience


None


Preferred Leadership Experience


None


Certifications


None


Competencies


Critical thinking skills to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions; ability to understand and foresee implications of new information for current and future problems solving.
An unquenchable intellectual curiosity for getting at the underlying story being told within the data.
Strong written and verbal communications skills. Ability to persuade, inform, and influence others based on findings. A track record of taking complex results and communicating them in an easily understood way.
Superior interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate actively and work in a team environment.
Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies, tools, and techniques.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Entry Level Data Analyst




Position Overview:

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Entry Level Data Analyst to join our data team and play a key role in shaping our data infrastructure and reporting systems. In this role, you‚Äôll develop and optimize SQL queries, work with large datasets, and support business intelligence initiatives across the organization. You‚Äôll collaborate with analysts, engineers, and business stakeholders to ensure data accuracy, accessibility, and performance. This is a great opportunity to work on impactful projects that directly support data-driven decisions and business growth.




Key Responsibilities:

Database Development & Optimization:

Design, write, and optimize complex SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and analyze data from various sources.
Develop stored procedures, views, and functions to support data transformation and reporting needs.
Ensure the efficiency and scalability of database systems through performance tuning and indexing.

Data Management & Integrity:

Clean, validate, and maintain data accuracy across multiple systems.
Collaborate with data engineers to integrate new data sources and improve ETL processes.
Implement best practices to ensure data quality, security, and compliance.

Reporting & Business Support:

Support reporting needs by providing accurate, timely data extracts and SQL-based reports.
Work closely with BI Analysts and stakeholders to define reporting requirements.
Enable self-service analytics by creating and maintaining data structures used in dashboards and reports.

Collaboration & Communication:

Partner with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver effective SQL solutions.
Translate business questions into efficient queries that deliver actionable insights.
Document processes and workflows to ensure clarity and continuity.

Continuous Improvement:

Stay current with the latest advancements in SQL development, database technologies, and BI tools.
Identify opportunities to streamline data workflows and improve system performance.
Provide input on data architecture and participate in data governance efforts.

Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Proven experience with SQL development and relational database systems (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MySQL).
Strong understanding of data modeling, database design, and ETL processes.
Familiarity with BI tools like Power BI or Tableau is a plus.
Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a passion for working with data.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data structures and solutions to non-technical stakeholders.




As a Data Analyst, you'll be at the heart of our data-driven initiatives, enabling accurate reporting and business insights that fuel our growth. If you're passionate about databases, love writing clean and efficient SQL, and want to make a tangible impact‚Äîwe‚Äôd love to hear from you.

HTML:
Entry Level Data Analyst


Position Overview:

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Entry Level Data Analyst to join our data team and play a key role in shaping our data infrastructure and reporting systems. In this role, you‚Äôll develop and optimize SQL queries, work with large datasets, and support business intelligence initiatives across the organization. You‚Äôll collaborate with analysts, engineers, and business stakeholders to ensure data accuracy, accessibility, and performance. This is a great opportunity to work on impactful projects that directly support data-driven decisions and business growth.


Key Responsibilities:

Database Development & Optimization:

  • Design, write, and optimize complex SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and analyze data from various sources.
  • Develop stored procedures, views, and functions to support data transformation and reporting needs.
  • Ensure the efficiency and scalability of database systems through performance tuning and indexing.

Data Management & Integrity:

  • Clean, validate, and maintain data accuracy across multiple systems.
  • Collaborate with data engineers to integrate new data sources and improve ETL processes.
  • Implement best practices to ensure data quality, security, and compliance.

Reporting & Business Support:

  • Support reporting needs by providing accurate, timely data extracts and SQL-based reports.
  • Work closely with BI Analysts and stakeholders to define reporting requirements.
  • Enable self-service analytics by creating and maintaining data structures used in dashboards and reports.

Collaboration & Communication:

  • Partner with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver effective SQL solutions.
  • Translate business questions into efficient queries that deliver actionable insights.
  • Document processes and workflows to ensure clarity and continuity.

Continuous Improvement:

  • Stay current with the latest advancements in SQL development, database technologies, and BI tools.
  • Identify opportunities to streamline data workflows and improve system performance.
  • Provide input on data architecture and participate in data governance efforts.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field.
  • Proven experience with SQL development and relational database systems (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MySQL).
  • Strong understanding of data modeling, database design, and ETL processes.
  • Familiarity with BI tools like Power BI or Tableau is a plus.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a passion for working with data.
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data structures and solutions to non-technical stakeholders.


As a Data Analyst, you'll be at the heart of our data-driven initiatives, enabling accurate reporting and business insights that fuel our growth. If you're passionate about databases, love writing clean and efficient SQL, and want to make a tangible impact‚Äîwe‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Title: Data Analyst/ Data Management
Description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Analyst specializing in Data Management with 8 to 11 years of experience.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in ML Ops AI & ML Concepts Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.

This hybrid role requires working in a day shift with no travel requirements. The candidate will play a crucial role in analyzing and managing data to drive business insights and support decision-making processes.

Responsibilities


Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify patterns and trends.
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
Utilize ML Ops to streamline and automate machine learning workflows. -
Apply AI and ML concepts to enhance data processing and predictive modeling. -
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and deliver data-driven solutions. -
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for data management processes and procedures. -
Ensure data integrity and accuracy by performing regular data audits and validation checks. -
rovide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support business decision-making. -
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize data and track key performance indicators. -
Stay updated with the latest advancements in machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies. -
Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues in a timely manner. -
Train and mentor junior team members on data analysis techniques and best practices. -
Ensure compliance with data governance and security policies.
Qualifications - - Must have extensive experience in ML Ops AI and ML Concepts Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. -
Should possess strong analytical skills with the ability to collect organize analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information. -
Must have proficiency in data visualization tools and techniques. -
Should have excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams. -
Must be detail-oriented with strong problem-solving abilities. -
Should have experience in creating and maintaining comprehensive documentation

Title: CRM Data Analyst - Spain
Description:
At Globant, we are working to make the world a better place, one step at a time. We enhance business development and enterprise solutions to prepare them for a digital future. With a diverse and talented team present in more than 30 countries, we are strategic partners to leading global companies in their business process transformation.

We seek a Data Analyst who shares our passion for innovation and change. This role is critical to helping our business partners evolve and adapt to consumers' personalized expectations in this new technological era.

What will help you succeed:


Dashboard development: Design and build interactive dashboards that enable clear visualization of KPIs and informed decision making.
Data analysis: Extract, transform, and analyze data from different sources to generate actionable insights and strategic recommendations.
Business Case Generation: Develop data models and business cases that support customer and stakeholder decision making.
Visual Representations: Create effective visualizations that communicate data analysis findings in an impactful way.
Optimization of digital marketing strategies: Provide data-driven recommendations to improve campaign performance and investment efficiency.
Collaboration with cross-functional teams: Work closely with Martech, Adtech, Product and Development teams to align strategies and business objectives.
Data quality control: Oversee the quality of data used in analytics, ensuring data integrity and consistency.



Requirements:


Educational background: Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Marketing, Computer Science or related fields.
Experience: Minimum 4 years of experience in data analysis, especially in digital marketing environments.
Analytical tools: Proficient in tools such as Google Analytics and Salesforce CRM Analytics.
Previous experience in CRM data analysis.
Business Intelligence Skills: Experience in extracting, transforming and loading (ETL) data for representation in dashboards.
Analytics Methodologies: Familiarity with predictive modeling techniques, audience segmentation and marketing attribution.
Digital marketing skills: Understanding of SEO/SEM, programmatic, email marketing, and social media strategies.
English: Intermediate-advanced level, able to work and present in international environments.
Desirable: Experience with CDP and DMP platforms, as well as certifications in data visualization tools or agile methodologies.



This job can be filled in MADRID or or .

Create with us digital products that people love. We will bring businesses and consumers together through AI technology and creativity, driving digital transformation to positively impact the world.

At Globant, we believe in fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a thriving and inclusive environment for all employees and candidates, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know by applying through our Career Site or contacting your assigned recruiter.

We may use AI and machine learning technologies in our recruitment process. Compensation is determined based on skills, qualifications, experience, and location. In addition to competitive salaries, we offer a comprehensive benefits package. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion and Globant‚Äôs Benefits.

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
üéØ Your mission

We are looking for a top-class Data Analyst to become part of our Partner Lifecycle team. This role will help the team better understand opportunities to activate and engage users, as well as enable senior stakeholders to understand the impact of the campaigns and make some of the most important decisions to ensure the long-term success of Playtomic. If you‚Äôre someone that enjoys challenges and building things from the ground up, this is the role for you!

üë©üèΩ‚Äçüíª What you‚Äôll be doing


Provide internal stakeholders support on all data related queries, including verifying data quality, analyzing data, isolating and diagnosing problems and resolving issues.
Be a key part of the Partner Lifecycle team.
Assist in designing and analyzing experiments (A/B testing, dif. in dif. etc.).
Design, publish and maintain Looker dashboards and visualization tools to facilitate campaign optimization and stakeholder reporting.
Conduct exploratory analysis and translate insights into quantifiable business opportunities.
Analyze and interpret CRM data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform strategic decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into actionable data-driven insights.
Ensure seamless integration of data into Braze for targeted and personalized messaging.



ü¶Ñ Our Ideal Player


3+ years work experience in data analysis, engineering or other technical positions.
BS/MS in Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics or other disciplines with demonstrated technical exposure.
Strong analytical mindset to deliver effective & pragmatic solutions.
Strong SQL skills - able to extract, manipulate, transform and analyze large volumes of data with a high level of accuracy.
Excellent communication, visualization & storytelling with data skills to both scientific and business audiences.
Outstanding attention to detail - you are methodical and thorough in your analyses (problem statement, data discovery to result communication).
Strong understanding of incrementality testing across multiple platforms.
Native/Fluent Spanish and proficient English



ü§ì Extra points:


A strong grasp of statistical concepts, especially those related to experiment design and analysis.
Good knowledge of BigQuery.
Certification in Braze or equivalent CRM platforms
Located in Barcelona/Madrid and love racket sports!


ü§ù What‚Äôs in it for you


Salary: Depending on experience, to be discussed in the People Team Interview
23 days of vacation + day off on your birthday + 2 days off for Wellness days in August.
1 additional day off per year worked.
Hybrid / Remote work.
Flexibility to attend team-building events.
Social benefits (63‚Ç¨ a month in one of these: health insurance/tickets restaurant), flexible spending (pre-tax) in training, kindergarten, and transportation.
Gympass discount
Perks related to the brand and our sponsorship agreements
Summer work schedule (July-August 7h/day Monday to Friday)



‚û°Ô∏è Our hiring process

Last, and for you to start warming up, we want to show you what our process looks like:


First Interview - with our Head of Partner Lifecycle
People Interview - Cultural fit in Playtomic, to define the conditions of our offer
Technical Interview - with a team member from Data
Final Interview with stakeholders from the Partner Development team



About Us üéæ

We are the world‚Äôs largest racket sports App for players and clubs. Our goal is to socialize sports practice: through the app, players can book courts, find other players with similar skill levels, and join a social community dedicated to playing. Since 2017, Playtomic has earned the trust of national and international investors, consolidating it as one of the main world players in sports digitalization., You will find 200+ co-workers around the world with headquarters in Spain and offices in Italy, Portugal, Sweden, Finland, Belgium, UK, EEUU and Mexico.

Take a look to our candidate playbook!

  • 1 additional day off per year worked.
  • Hybrid / Remote work.
  • Flexibility to attend team-building events.
  • Social benefits (63‚Ç¨ a month in one of these: health insurance/tickets restaurant), flexible spending (pre-tax) in training, kindergarten, and transportation.
  • Gympass discount
  • Perks related to the brand and our sponsorship agreements
  • Summer work schedule (July-August 7h/day Monday to Friday)


‚û°Ô∏è Our hiring process

Last, and for you to start warming up, we want to show you what our process looks like:

  • First Interview - with our Head of Partner Lifecycle
  • People Interview - Cultural fit in Playtomic, to define the conditions of our offer
  • Technical Interview - with a team member from Data
  • Final Interview with stakeholders from the Partner Development team


About Us üéæ

We are the world‚Äôs largest racket sports App for players and clubs. Our goal is to socialize sports practice: through the app, players can book courts, find other players with similar skill levels, and join a social community dedicated to playing. Since 2017, Playtomic has earned the trust of national and international investors, consolidating it as one of the main world players in sports digitalization., You will find 200+ co-workers around the world with headquarters in Spain and offices in Italy, Portugal, Sweden, Finland, Belgium, UK, EEUU and Mexico.

Title: Senior, Data Analyst
Description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...

About Team:

Walmart Health and Wellness is on a mission to build a cutting-edge customer facing digital experience to help customers manage their prescriptions & medications and take care of themselves and their loved ones with different health services. We are building a secure and resilient platform on the backbone of digital and cloud to achieve this goal.

*Immigration sponsorship Support is NOT available in this role*

What you'll do:


Solid grasp of business concepts and objectives and the ability to translate business requirements into technical requirements
Proven experience and skillset to use data and critical thinking to solve business problems and generate insights
Ability to build complex SQL models that are robust, efficient, and scalable for data manipulation, reporting, and analytics
Influence and educate the team with your experience, idea and learning.


What you'll bring:


Expereince with Relational database modeling and implementation using SQL
Expereince with SQL skill is required
Experience leveraging big data technologies such as Hive, Hadoop, Spark
Experience with visualization tools for data reporting such as Tableau, Looker
Excellent communication skills for collaborating with other teams
Appreciate productivity and care deeply about helping others work more effectively and efficiently


The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.

About Walmart Global Tech

Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That‚Äôs what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We‚Äôre a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world‚Äôs leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.

Benefits and Perks

Beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great benefits include a 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, flexible working hours, and more.

We are reimagining the tech workplace by making a permanent transition to virtual work for most of our team. Of course, being together in person is an important part of our culture and shared success. We‚Äôll collaborate in person at a regular cadence and with purpose.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer ‚Äì By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions ‚Äì while being inclusive of all people.

At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.

‚Äé

‚Äé

‚Äé

You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable.

‚Äé

For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices.

‚Äé

‚Äé

Live Better U is a Walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.

‚Äé

Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms.

‚Äé

For Information About Benefits And Eligibility, See One.Walmart.

‚Äé

The annual salary range for this position is $104,000.00-$202,000.00

‚Äé

Additional Compensation Includes Annual Or Quarterly Performance Bonuses.

‚Äé

Additional compensation for certain positions may also include:

‚Äé

‚Äé


Stock


‚Äé

‚Äé

Minimum Qualifications...

Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.

Option 1: Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Arts, Finance or related field and 2 years' experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field. Option 2: Master's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field. Option 3: 4 years' experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field.

Preferred Qualifications...

Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.

Data science, data analysis, statistics, or related field, Master‚Äôs degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field, Related industry experience (for example, retail, merchandising, healthcare, eCommerce), Successful completion of assessments in data analysis and Business Intelligence tools and scripting languages (for example, SQL, Python, Spark, Scala, R, Power BI, or Tableau)

Title: Analyst, Analytics
Description:
Company Description

With a history that dates back over 80 years, Starcom is a global communications planning and media leader. We are an agency still grounded in our founding principle that people are at center of all we do. Each day, we apply this belief to harness the transformative power of data and technology to inspire and move people and business forward. With more than 7,000 employees in over 100 offices around the world, Starcom partners with the world's leading marketers and brands, including Bank of America, Best Buy, Kellogg Company, McDonald's, Novartis, Samsung, Visa and more.

Overview

What You‚Äôll Do:

The Starcom Applied Analytics team draws on the dynamic advertising technology space, digital and offline analytics, and evolving methodologies to address complex research and measurement challenges across Starcom client brands.

The Analyst position is an entry-level position that uses research, data, reporting and analytics techniques to answer client business questions, assists with developing ‚Äòtest-and-learn‚Äô approaches that roll-up to the client‚Äôs larger learning objectives, and implements best practices around research, analytics and campaign measurement.

Responsibilities


Help drive day-to-day research & analytics efforts while delivering impactful, actionable insights
Support execution of customer, media, brand, and market research that produce unique insights and opportunities
Synthesize research results and uncover overarching themes to drive the client‚Äôs business forward
Report on key metrics for campaign effectiveness and develop key findings for optimization
Facilitate the sharing of data and insights among relevant internal parties to inform future strategies
Develop and analyze media and brand targets that inform media strategies
Apply syndicated research (Nielsen, MRI, ComScore, eMarketer, etc.) and agency research applications to client business
Foster strong relationships with internal client teams
Assist internal groups in maximizing the use of available research sources and proprietary studies


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree preferred, preferably with a concentration in marketing, advertising, communications, business, sociology, or consumer insights
6+ months of related experience
Experience in media/marketing research, consumer insights, business consulting, or data analysis
Demonstrated interest in quantitative and qualitative research, experimental design, and data analysis
Resourceful, curious, and motivated individual with an ability to work independently as well as in a team setting
Knowledge of statistical software packages and coding languages (e.g. SAS, SPSS, R, Python)is a plus
Experience with Tableau, GoodData, Datorama, SQL is a plus
Strong organizational and communication skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite with intermediate to advanced understanding of Excel


Additional Information

Starcom is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our employment decisions are made without regard to actual or perceived race, color, ethnicity, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability, medical condition as defined by applicable state law, genetic information, marital status, military service and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances.

Benefits

The Power of One starts with our people! To do powerful things, we offer powerful resources. Our best-in-class wellness and benefits offerings include:


Paid Family Care for parents and caregivers for 12 weeks or more
Monetary assistance and support for Adoption, Surrogacy and Fertility
Monetary assistance and support for pet adoption
Employee Assistance Programs and Health/Wellness/Comfort reimbursements to help you invest in your future and work/life balance
Tuition Assistance

HTML:
Company Description

With a history that dates back over 80 years, Starcom is a global communications planning and media leader. We are an agency still grounded in our founding principle that people are at center of all we do. Each day, we apply this belief to harness the transformative power of data and technology to inspire and move people and business forward. With more than 7,000 employees in over 100 offices around the world, Starcom partners with the world's leading marketers and brands, including Bank of America, Best Buy, Kellogg Company, McDonald's, Novartis, Samsung, Visa and more.

Overview

What You‚Äôll Do:

The Starcom Applied Analytics team draws on the dynamic advertising technology space, digital and offline analytics, and evolving methodologies to address complex research and measurement challenges across Starcom client brands.

The Analyst position is an entry-level position that uses research, data, reporting and analytics techniques to answer client business questions, assists with developing ‚Äòtest-and-learn‚Äô approaches that roll-up to the client‚Äôs larger learning objectives, and implements best practices around research, analytics and campaign measurement.

Responsibilities

  • Help drive day-to-day research & analytics efforts while delivering impactful, actionable insights
  • Support execution of customer, media, brand, and market research that produce unique insights and opportunities
  • Synthesize research results and uncover overarching themes to drive the client‚Äôs business forward
  • Report on key metrics for campaign effectiveness and develop key findings for optimization
  • Facilitate the sharing of data and insights among relevant internal parties to inform future strategies
  • Develop and analyze media and brand targets that inform media strategies
  • Apply syndicated research (Nielsen, MRI, ComScore, eMarketer, etc.) and agency research applications to client business
  • Foster strong relationships with internal client teams
  • Assist internal groups in maximizing the use of available research sources and proprietary studies

Qualifications

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree preferred, preferably with a concentration in marketing, advertising, communications, business, sociology, or consumer insights
  • 6+ months of related experience
  • Experience in media/marketing research, consumer insights, business consulting, or data analysis
  • Demonstrated interest in quantitative and qualitative research, experimental design, and data analysis
  • Resourceful, curious, and motivated individual with an ability to work independently as well as in a team setting
  • Knowledge of statistical software packages and coding languages (e.g. SAS, SPSS, R, Python)is a plus
  • Experience with Tableau, GoodData, Datorama, SQL is a plus
  • Strong organizational and communication skills
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite with intermediate to advanced understanding of Excel

Additional Information

Starcom is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our employment decisions are made without regard to actual or perceived race, color, ethnicity, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability, medical condition as defined by applicable state law, genetic information, marital status, military service and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances.

Benefits

The Power of One starts with our people! To do powerful things, we offer powerful resources. Our best-in-class wellness and benefits offerings include:

  • Paid Family Care for parents and caregivers for 12 weeks or more
  • Monetary assistance and support for Adoption, Surrogacy and Fertility
  • Monetary assistance and support for pet adoption
  • Employee Assistance Programs and Health/Wellness/Comfort reimbursements to help you invest in your future and work/life balance
  • Tuition Assistance
  • Paid time off that includes Flexible Time off Vacation, Annual Sick Days, Volunteer Days, Holiday and Identity days, and more
  • Matching Gifts programs
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • 'Work Your World‚Äô Program encouraging employees to work from anywhere Publicis Groupe has an office for up to 6 weeks a year (based upon eligibility)
  • Business Resource Groups that support multiple affinities and alliances

The benefits offerings listed are available to U.S. based employees, are reviewed on an annual basis, and are governed by the terms of the applicable plan documents.

Compensation Range: $54,910.00 - $75,915.00 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. Temporary roles may also qualify for participation in our 401(k) plan after eligibility criteria have been met. For regular roles, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. Title: Data Intern
Description:
At Doing Things, our process is unique, but our purpose is clear. We connect consumers across the world through humor and happiness. Doing Things is responsible for the funniest, most shareable, and culturally relevant memes and video content on the Internet. The company is making ordinary life relatable, humorous and entertaining through a portfolio that includes some of the most popular brands built on Instagram, including Middle Class Fancy, Shithead Steve, Overheard, Recess Therapy, Bob Does Sports and Animals Doing Things, among others. Through its IP, Doing Things fuels consumer products, branded content, video licensing, publishing and original entertainment across digital and linear TV.

Founded in 2017, Doing Things touts more than 35+ unique brands and delivers more than 100 pieces of original and curated content daily to an audience of more than 80 million followers across Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, YouTube and Snap. This includes the company‚Äôs fast-growing direct-to-consumer products business, featuring comedic apparel and accessories based on what‚Äôs trending, as well as our Breezy golf apparel line.

Today, Doing Things is looking to expand its team as we extend our reach to bring smiles to millions of new community members across the globe.

Responsibilities


Accurately input data into company databases and systems
Verify and correct data discrepancies
Maintain confidentiality and security of data
Collaborate with team members to ensure data accuracy
Generate reports and prepare data for analysis
Perform administrative tasks as needed


Qualifications


Must be a college student, currently enrolled, with the ability to receive college credits for internship.
Must be based in New York, NY or Los Angeles, CA
Attention to detail and strong organizational skills
Basic understanding of data management
Basic analytical skills
Good communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to work independently and collaboratively
Proficiency in Instagram Insights
Proficiency in Google Workspace

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Our Organization

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About The Team

Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

About The Role

The B2C Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.

You will primarily support the Consumer side of the business, which includes WSJ, Barron's, MarketWatch and more; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as advertising and the professional information business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. You will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

You Will

Develop Stakeholder Partnerships


Develop strong partnerships with Product, Marketing, Newsroom, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2C Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
Executie data project roadmaps based on Business teams' priorities.


Understand B2C Data


Build a deep understanding of all the B2C data sources that we leverage in our Analysis projects
Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and organize data.


Conduct Analysis, Create Dashboards, Improve Processes & Ensure Quality


Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker Studio)
Continuously identify ways to improve and streamline processes around data and reporting
Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency


Clearly Communicate


Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences


You Have


Team oriented and collaborative with eagerness to help others, and aspiration to be challenged and learn
Self starter able to work independently, coordinate with multiple partners and complete projects start to finish
Detail oriented with focus on assuring quality, consistency and accuracy in data and processes
Undergraduate degree or equivalent in combination of training and experience, preferably in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related disciplines.
Experience working with large datasets in a fast-paced and fluid environment with the ability to understand and solve complex non-routine problems.
Experience with SQL and strong knowledge of Excel/Sheets required. Familiarity with Github, Python/R preferred.
Experience with web analytics tools (particularly Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics) is a plus.

HTML:
About Our Organization

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About The Team

Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

About The Role

The B2C Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.

You will primarily support the Consumer side of the business, which includes WSJ, Barron's, MarketWatch and more; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as advertising and the professional information business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. You will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

You Will

Develop Stakeholder Partnerships

  • Develop strong partnerships with Product, Marketing, Newsroom, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2C Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
  • Executie data project roadmaps based on Business teams' priorities.

Understand B2C Data

  • Build a deep understanding of all the B2C data sources that we leverage in our Analysis projects
  • Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and organize data.

Conduct Analysis, Create Dashboards, Improve Processes & Ensure Quality

  • Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
  • Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker Studio)
  • Continuously identify ways to improve and streamline processes around data and reporting
  • Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency

Clearly Communicate

  • Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences

You Have

  • Team oriented and collaborative with eagerness to help others, and aspiration to be challenged and learn
  • Self starter able to work independently, coordinate with multiple partners and complete projects start to finish
  • Detail oriented with focus on assuring quality, consistency and accuracy in data and processes
  • Undergraduate degree or equivalent in combination of training and experience, preferably in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related disciplines.
  • Experience working with large datasets in a fast-paced and fluid environment with the ability to understand and solve complex non-routine problems.
  • Experience with SQL and strong knowledge of Excel/Sheets required. Familiarity with Github, Python/R preferred.
  • Experience with web analytics tools (particularly Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics) is a plus.
  • Experience with data visualizations tools and techniques, and using data to tell a story (e.g. Tableau, Looker)

  • Comprehensive Healthcare Plans
  • Paid Time Off
  • Retirement Plans
  • Comprehensive Insurance Plans
  • Lifestyle programs & Wellness Resources
  • Education Benefits
  • Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support
  • Commuter Transit Program
