Title: Internship, Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst Intern for our dynamic market Intelligence team.

Responsibilities


Search for opportunities for business development and increase of company's market share in different services
Regular analysis of the company's performance
Convert the information into knowledge in order to increase company's competitiveness
Develop and maintain regulatory databases
Create, update and organize database of potential international customers
Support regional teams across the globe
Attend meetings with sales and business development managers based internationally


Qualifications


Degree in Business Administration / Data Analysis / Economics/ International Business.
Knowledge in Big Data a plus.
Fluent in English, Intermediate in Spanish.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft windows applications (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint)
MI tools such as Power Bi, MACRO, Data Scrapping tools are preferred.
Able to communicate effectively at all levels.
Willing to learn.
Proactive, organized, and multitasking with great team spirit.
Mission: At UL, we know why we come to work. Shape the way we approach and deliver our solutions to have a meaningful contribution to society.
People: Be part of our global team and do your best work! Teamwork, open-feedback and our diversity are our drivers to reach our common mission.
Interesting work: The work that goes on inside UL is fuelling the future. It challenges you to try fresh approaches, work autonomously, drive change and gain in-depth experience in your field.
Grow & achieve: Growth and development are part of our DNA. Grow & achieve with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as your very own UL University.
This is our normal: Competitive remuneration, annual bonus, flexible hours, home office options, paid annual leave.


About Us

A global leader in applied safety science, UL Solutions (NYSE: ULS) transforms safety, security and sustainability challenges into opportunities for customers in more than 110 countries. UL Solutions delivers testing, inspection and certification services, together with software products and advisory offerings, that support our customers‚Äô product innovation and business growth. The UL Mark serves as a recognized symbol of trust in our customers‚Äô products and reflects an unwavering commitment to advancing our safety mission. We help our customers innovate, launch new products and services, navigate global markets and complex supply chains, and grow sustainably and responsibly into the future. Our science is your advantage.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Story so far: Who we are




Founded in August 2020, Huspy started as a digital mortgage platform and quickly evolved into the largest proptech company in the EMEA region. Backed by leading investors such as Sequoia, Balderton, Founders Fund, and Olayan, we have experienced rapid growth with offices in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Madrid, and Valencia. Our mission is to revolutionize the real estate industry by building an all-in-one super app designed to empower agents and mortgage brokers.




The Main Event: What you'll do¬†




Our Data team is at the heart of our decision-making, providing the insights and infrastructure to fuel growth and innovation. Join us to play a vital role in transforming data into actionable intelligence at Huspy!




You‚Äôll join Huspy‚Äôs Data team as a Data Analyst with a focus on Business Intelligence, where you‚Äôll support business units by delivering actionable insights and creating impactful reports. Your work will be crucial in helping teams make data-driven decisions, optimize performance, and align with Huspy‚Äôs business objectives. You will take ownership of BI tools and dashboards, ensuring data quality and reliability for stakeholders across the organization.




Responsibilities:





Develop and Maintain BI Dashboards: Design, build, and maintain dashboards and reports in Tableau (preferred) or similar BI tools, ensuring they provide clear and actionable insights for business stakeholders.


Data Extraction and Analysis: Use SQL and other data extraction tools to gather, clean, and analyze data from various sources, including Snowflake.


Collaborate with Stakeholders: Work closely with business, product, and engineering teams to understand their data needs, translating business questions into analytical requirements and solutions.


Optimize Reporting: Continuously enhance reporting systems for scalability and efficiency, ensuring reports are easy to access, interpret, and act upon.


Support Data-Driven Decisions: Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support decision-making and performance optimization.


Ensure Data Quality: Implement quality checks and maintain data accuracy across BI systems, working with data engineering to resolve any data issues.


Document BI Processes: Create and maintain documentation for BI processes, data definitions, and dashboard usage guidelines to support consistency and transparency.





The Perfect Match: What you bring





Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Data Science, Business Analytics). A Master‚Äôs degree is a plus.


Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data analytics or BI-focused role.


BI and Visualization Expertise: Strong proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau (preferred), Power BI, or Looker, with the ability to create visually compelling and easy-to-navigate dashboards.


Technical Proficiency: Advanced SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation; familiarity with data platforms like Snowflake (preferred) is beneficial.


Data Analysis and Reporting Skills: Experience in conducting data analysis and generating insights to support business needs, including KPI tracking and performance reporting.


ETL Skills: Familiarity with ETL processes for data preparation, ensuring clean, accurate, and well-organized data for analysis.


Attention to Detail: Strong commitment to accuracy, with the ability to identify and correct data discrepancies.


Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex findings clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Collaborative Spirit: Experience working cross-functionally, especially with product, engineering, and business teams to align data insights with business strategies.





What will set you apart





Experience with Our Tool Stack: Hands-on experience with Tableau, Snowflake, dbt, and Airflow is a strong plus.


Advanced Analytical Knowledge: Proficiency in Python or R for advanced data analysis and modeling.


Experience in Data-Driven Organizations: Previous experience in a fast-paced, data-centric environment where BI plays a strategic role in decision-making.


Business Acumen: Strong understanding of business processes, KPIs, and metrics relevant to the PropTech or startup sector.

  • Optimize Reporting: Continuously enhance reporting systems for scalability and efficiency, ensuring reports are easy to access, interpret, and act upon.

  • Support Data-Driven Decisions: Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support decision-making and performance optimization.

  • Ensure Data Quality: Implement quality checks and maintain data accuracy across BI systems, working with data engineering to resolve any data issues.

  • Document BI Processes: Create and maintain documentation for BI processes, data definitions, and dashboard usage guidelines to support consistency and transparency.


The Perfect Match: What you bring



  • Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Data Science, Business Analytics). A Master‚Äôs degree is a plus.

  • Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data analytics or BI-focused role.

  • BI and Visualization Expertise: Strong proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau (preferred), Power BI, or Looker, with the ability to create visually compelling and easy-to-navigate dashboards.

  • Technical Proficiency: Advanced SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation; familiarity with data platforms like Snowflake (preferred) is beneficial.

  • Data Analysis and Reporting Skills: Experience in conducting data analysis and generating insights to support business needs, including KPI tracking and performance reporting.

  • ETL Skills: Familiarity with ETL processes for data preparation, ensuring clean, accurate, and well-organized data for analysis.

  • Attention to Detail: Strong commitment to accuracy, with the ability to identify and correct data discrepancies.

  • Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex findings clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Collaborative Spirit: Experience working cross-functionally, especially with product, engineering, and business teams to align data insights with business strategies.


What will set you apart



  • Experience with Our Tool Stack: Hands-on experience with Tableau, Snowflake, dbt, and Airflow is a strong plus.

  • Advanced Analytical Knowledge: Proficiency in Python or R for advanced data analysis and modeling.

  • Experience in Data-Driven Organizations: Previous experience in a fast-paced, data-centric environment where BI plays a strategic role in decision-making.

  • Business Acumen: Strong understanding of business processes, KPIs, and metrics relevant to the PropTech or startup sector.

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Semasio, a Samba TV company, is a dynamic global company with access to the world's most progressive audiences and the most comprehensive contextual platform available. Fortune 500 companies and emerging brands trust our industry-leading advertising solutions to increase reach, boost efficiency, and maximize ROI. Our team is located globally in the US, UK, Portugal, Germany, and Denmark.




We remain tight-knit across time zones through open communication and consistent collaboration. We care about cultivating an inclusive, approachable and ambitious culture while having fun along the way. We believe diversity fosters creativity, innovation and a sense of community. Join us in our mission to lead the privacy-first performance revolution. If this sparks your curiosity, then read on!




Are you passionate about turning data into insights? Do you have a keen eye for detail and a drive to optimize business performance? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! We are looking for a Junior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our dynamic team in

Porto. In this role, you will play a key part in ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and efficiency of our data models and reports. Your contributions will directly impact strategic decision-making, providing stakeholders with critical insights to drive the company forward.




What You‚Äôll Do:
Maintain and update our BI data model, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Own specific monthly reports and updates, ensuring timely and precise delivery.
Work closely with different teams to understand reporting needs and enhance data quality.
Identify opportunities to improve data structures and reporting processes.
Assist in troubleshooting and resolving data inconsistencies or anomalies.
Support the development of new dashboards and analytics solutions.




What We‚Äôre Looking For:
Strong attention to detail‚Äînothing slips past you!
A problem-solving mindset with a passion for optimizing data processes.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker).
Basic understanding of data modeling concepts and database structures.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
A proactive attitude, always looking for ways to improve and streamline reporting.
A degree in Business, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field is a plus.




Why Join Us?
Be part of a data-driven company that values innovation and continuous learning.
Work in a collaborative and supportive environment where your contributions matter.
Opportunity for professional growth and development in the exciting field of Business Intelligence.









Samba TV is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.¬†¬†We strive to empower connection with one another, reflect the communities we serve, and tackle meaningful projects that make a real impact.




Samba TV may collect personal information directly from you, as a job applicant, Samba TV may also receive personal information from third parties, for example, in connection with a background, employment or reference check, under the applicable law.¬†For further details, please see Samba's¬†Applicant Privacy Policy.¬†For residents of the EU, Samba Inc. is the data controller.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Learn About Knok

At knok, we dare to lead and humanise the digital transformation of healthcare. We envision a world where everyone has timely access to quality healthcare through digital technology, creating a more equal society. We genuinely believe in it and you can recognise it in every person who embraces this mission.

Through a Digital Front Door strategy, knok connects patients, providers and healthcare professionals in one place. Our API-first white-label platform enables a continuous, engaging and personalised healthcare experience for all conditions through a cutting-edge Patient Journey Engine.

With regular clinical practice as our main source of knowledge, we leverage ready-to-use data to improve care automation and increase financial savings. Since 2015, we have enabled more than 2.5 million clinical interactions in over 12 countries. Our platform is scalable and AI-ready, enhancing the power of data-driven care to deliver better outcomes during all stages of life.

Are you ready to join us in revolutionising healthcare and making a tangible impact on people's lives?

About The Role

We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to gather, analyse, and interpret business data from multiple sources to extract meaningful insights that drive business decisions. You will play a crucial role in maintaining and improving data processes, ensuring high data quality, and supporting different teams with analytical insights. If this sounds exciting, keep reading!

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will:


Collect, clean, and analyse data to generate valuable business insights,
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualisations to support strategic decision-making,
Automate recurring reports and data processes to improve efficiency,
Support forecasting activities for different services, ensuring accurate planning and resource allocation,
Ensure data integrity and quality, identifying and resolving inconsistencies or anomalies,
Work closely with cross-functional teams to provide data-driven recommendations,
Optimise and automate the medical hours allocation process to enhance operational efficiency


Here are the skills we're looking for:


Bachelor's degree in Management, Biomedical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or a related field
1 to 2 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar role
Strong Excel skills (data manipulation, advanced formulas, VBA)
Experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI, Apache Superset, or similar)
Critical thinking and problem-solving mindset to translate data into actionable insights
Storytelling with data - ability to communicate findings clearly to different stakeholders
Strong collaboration and communication skills to work effectively with multidisciplinary teams


Nice to have:


Experience with SQL for querying databases
Familiarity with Apache Superset or similar business intelligence tools
Previous experience in healthcare analytics or the healthcare industry

Title: Data Analyst - Junior/Senior Level
Description:
ü§îWho are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.







üîé We are looking for a Data Analyst - Junior and Senior Level




MAIN TASKS:

Analyze large volumes of data to help with business decisions.
Create dashboards and reports in Power BI to show results clearly.
Process, clean and transform data with Python, PySpark or Scala, especially in Big Data environments.
Building data pipelines (ETL) and preparing datasets for analysis.
Collaboration with technical and business teams to ensure data quality and consistency.
Supporting continuous improvement and data governance initiatives.
Automate processes to save time and avoid errors.




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Experience in Power BI (modeling, DAX, visualizations).
Python skills applied to data analysis.
Knowledge of PySpark / Spark / Scala (valued in Big Data environments).
Solid knowledge of SQL.
Notions of data quality and governance.
Good communication skills (technical and non-technical).
Analytical mind and problem-solving orientation.
Proactivity and a sense of responsibility.
Proficiency in English (minimum B2).




üìçHybrid Role in Porto.




üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (f/m/d)




As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting our in-house digital agency team by analysing and interpreting data to drive strategic decision-making.

Your primary responsibility will be to develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards on PowerBI, providing actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis. You will integrate a data team and collaborate closely with the digital marketing team to identify key performance indicators (KPIs), track campaign performance, and uncover opportunities for optimization.

Youe role in our team




‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the digital marketing team to identify data requirements, KPIs, and reporting needs.

‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain interactive dashboards on PowerBI to track KPIs, campaign performance and overall business goals.

‚Ä¢ Perform in-depth analysis of data to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.

‚Ä¢ Conduct ad hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support decision-making.

‚Ä¢ Create data visualisations, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to experts.

‚Ä¢ Monitor data quality, identify data discrepancies, and work with relevant teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

‚Ä¢ Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging tools in data analysis, visualization, and reporting.

Your profile:




‚Ä¢ Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, and analyse significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in creating interactive dashboards and reports using PowerBi.

‚Ä¢ Knowledge on Python and SQL for data extraction, manipulation and automation is highly desirable.

‚Ä¢ Knowledge on Databricks and Microsoft fabric is a plus.

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with digital marketing concepts, metrics and platforms (e.g., LinkedIn Ads and Google Analytics) is a plus.

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Your benefits

We offer you:

‚Ä¢ Possibility of Working from Home ‚Äì we care about results not locations;

‚Ä¢ Training Budget for each employee ‚Äì we care about the growth of our people;

‚Ä¢ Private Health Insurance ‚Äì we care about health on and off working hours;

‚Ä¢ 3 Additional Vacation Days ‚Äì we care about free time;

‚Ä¢ Cooking, sports or book club ‚Äì we care about spending time with our folks;

‚Ä¢ Fresh fruits ‚Äì we care about your daily dose of vitamins;

‚Ä¢ Fresh coffee, tea or water ‚Äì we care about boosting your day.

‚Ä¢ A home for passionate people who innovate, collaborate and love what they do;




An environment where the team thinks and acts entrepreneurial;

An international and dynamic working atmosphere with cross-functional teams;

The opportunity to take more responsibility and develop your career.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal and external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholder


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs degree in Information Technology and Computer Science, or Mathematics and Statistics
Up to 2 years of professional experience in data analytics
Proficiency in Data Viz Blending Analytics (Tableau and Power BI) as well as Database Management Microsoft SQL Server
Fluent in English, oral and written
Good communication skills
Analytical
Capable of synthetize and simplify
Able to deliver and results driven


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

  • Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management

Your Main Activities Are

  • Collaborate with internal and external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
  • Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
  • Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
  • Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas

Title: Data Analyst Mid
Description:
Data Analyst (f/m/d)

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting our in-house digital agency team by analysing and interpreting data to drive strategic decision-making.

Your primary responsibility will be to develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards on PowerBI, providing actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis. You will integrate a data team and collaborate closely with the digital marketing team to identify key performance indicators (KPIs), track campaign performance, and uncover opportunities for optimization.

You Will Be Responsible For



Collaborate with the digital marketing team to identify data requirements, KPIs, and reporting needs.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards on PowerBI to track KPIs, campaign performance and overall business goals.
Perform in-depth analysis of data to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Conduct ad hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support decision-making.
Create data visualisations, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to experts.
Monitor data quality, identify data discrepancies, and work with relevant teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging tools in data analysis, visualization, and reporting.



Your Profile



Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, and analyse significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficiency in creating interactive dashboards and reports using PowerBi.
Knowledge on Python and SQL for data extraction, manipulation and automation is highly desirable.
Knowledge on Databricks and Microsoft fabric is a plus.
Familiarity with digital marketing concepts, metrics and platforms (e.g., LinkedIn Ads and Google Analytics) is a plus.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.



Benefits + Application

We Offer You



Possibility of Working from Home ‚Äì we care about results not locations;
Training Budget for each employee ‚Äì we care about the growth of our people;
Private Health Insurance ‚Äì we care about health on and off working hours;
3 Additional Vacation Days ‚Äì we care about free time;
Cooking, sports or book club ‚Äì we care about spending time with our folks;
Fresh fruits ‚Äì we care about your daily dose of vitamins;
Fresh coffee, tea or water ‚Äì we care about boosting your day.
A home for passionate people who innovate, collaborate and love what they do;



An environment where the team thinks and acts entrepreneurial;

An international and dynamic working atmosphere with cross-functional teams;

The opportunity to take more responsibility and develop your career.

Title: Data Analyst (Power BI) ‚Äì All genders - Oporto ‚Äì Open Ended Contract ‚Äì Hybrid
Description:
WHO ARE WE ?

BNP PARIBAS CARDIF, the Insurer for a Changing World.

We are the world leader in the creditor insurance market with strong positions in savings and protection insurance in more than 30 countries all around the world.

European Service Center - Cardif Services, European Platform of Services with a diversity of processes aiming to bring excellence to our Internal Clients, being part of BNP Paribas Cardif, is an organization dedicated to providing other BNP Paribas Cardif entities with a diversity of processes and services connected to insurance activity. We aim to bring excellence to our internal clients, ensuring highest levels of efficiency and reliability. With over 480 employees and 6 working languages, we are a multicultural and a diverse team, operating in Porto and Lisbon, Portugal.

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst (M/F) based in Oporto

BE PART OF OUR DYNAMIC RSBI TEAM

As a Technical expert / administrator of Data Visualization et Data Preparation solution, you will have to ensure the functioning of existing Dashboards (based on DataViz solutions) et Data preparation tools, and develop new ones for Finance and Actuarial needs

YOUR FUTURE MISSION IN RSBI TEAM


Create and maintain DataPrep wokflow / tools (Alteryx / Dataiku)
Modeling and development of dashboards within PowerBi and Tableau technologies
Write functional and/or technical documentation and create POCs (Proof Of Concept)
Ensure diagnostics and resolution of malfunctions
Participate to the implementation process improvements
Manipulate data to facilitate decisions by Finance teams


As Our New Accounting Analyst, You Must Have


Information systems background
Professional background about 2/3 years in a similar position
Knowledge of Application design and Data Visualization modeling
Data Preparation workflow modeling (Dataiku and Alteryx)
Databases / SQL language and Data Modeling (DMC)
Data Visualization / Restitution tools (mainly Tableau and Power BI)
Be fluent in English (B2/C1 level) and French is a plus


What Do We Offer

Besides our attractive salary, you will benefit :


Meals allowance
Transportation allowance
Child allowance
Private Health Insurance including spouse and descendants, Life Insurance, Travel Insurance
Hybrid working mode ‚Äì a balance between office days to reinforce commitment, creativity and human links, and homeworking days for flexibility of the employees
Continuous development and career growth opportunities on a local and global level
And much more‚Ä¶


The work environment is important!


Benefit from our modern amenities, including zen and creative rooms amongst others, many discounts from our group platform, free language courses, doctor on-site & remote and diverse company events,
Work in a multicultural environment with multiple nationalities,
Be part of a people care company with a strong & continuous growth investing in its employees through training and career opportunities.


Our commitments to you


Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas Cardif is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas Cardif we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas Cardif, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment.

If your profile and motivations matches our needs and you feel motivated to join our company, do not hesitate in sending us you application.

We will be delighted to consider you for this position.

Please note that only applications submitted with CV, Cover letter & Certificate of Studies will be considered and move forward in the application process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (1 Year Maternity Cover)

‚Ç¨40,000 - ‚Ç¨45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Porto (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate ‚Ç¨22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty‚Äôs, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Herm√®s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ü§îWho are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 10 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto and Casablanca. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.







Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:




‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems




In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.







üîéWe are looking for a Data Analyst







MAIN TASKS:




Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management;
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting, and data mining.




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in fields such as computer science, data science, or related fields.
Experience with data knowledge/data processing/data quality
Experience with Database Management (SQL)
Experience with Power BI and Tableau
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a team.
Fluency in English (written and spoken).
Hybrid role based in Porto.







üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Data Analyst (Power BI) ‚Äì All genders - Oporto ‚Äì Open Ended Contract ‚Äì Hybrid
Description:
WHO ARE WE ?

BNP PARIBAS CARDIF, the Insurer for a Changing World.

We are the world leader in the creditor insurance market with strong positions in savings and protection insurance in more than 30 countries all around the world.

European Service Center - Cardif Services, European Platform of Services with a diversity of processes aiming to bring excellence to our Internal Clients, being part of BNP Paribas Cardif, is an organization dedicated to providing other BNP Paribas Cardif entities with a diversity of processes and services connected to insurance activity. We aim to bring excellence to our internal clients, ensuring highest levels of efficiency and reliability. With over 480 employees and 6 working languages, we are a multicultural and a diverse team, operating in Porto and Lisbon, Portugal.

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst (M/F) based in Oporto

BE PART OF OUR DYNAMIC RSBI TEAM

As a Technical expert / administrator of Data Visualization et Data Preparation solution, you will have to ensure the functioning of existing Dashboards (based on DataViz solutions) et Data preparation tools, and develop new ones for Finance and Actuarial needs

YOUR FUTURE MISSION IN RSBI TEAM


Create and maintain DataPrep wokflow / tools (Alteryx / Dataiku)
Modeling and development of dashboards within PowerBi and Tableau technologies
Write functional and/or technical documentation and create POCs (Proof Of Concept)
Ensure diagnostics and resolution of malfunctions
Participate to the implementation process improvements
Manipulate data to facilitate decisions by Finance teams


As Our New Accounting Analyst, You Must Have


Information systems background
Professional background about 2/3 years in a similar position
Knowledge of Application design and Data Visualization modeling
Data Preparation workflow modeling (Dataiku and Alteryx)
Databases / SQL language and Data Modeling (DMC)
Data Visualization / Restitution tools (mainly Tableau and Power BI)
Be fluent in English (B2/C1 level) and French is a plus


What Do We Offer

Besides our attractive salary, you will benefit :


Meals allowance
Transportation allowance
Child allowance
Private Health Insurance including spouse and descendants, Life Insurance, Travel Insurance
Hybrid working mode ‚Äì a balance between office days to reinforce commitment, creativity and human links, and homeworking days for flexibility of the employees
Continuous development and career growth opportunities on a local and global level
And much more‚Ä¶


The work environment is important!


Benefit from our modern amenities, including zen and creative rooms amongst others, many discounts from our group platform, free language courses, doctor on-site & remote and diverse company events,
Work in a multicultural environment with multiple nationalities,
Be part of a people care company with a strong & continuous growth investing in its employees through training and career opportunities.


Our commitments to you


Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas Cardif is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas Cardif we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas Cardif, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment.

If your profile and motivations matches our needs and you feel motivated to join our company, do not hesitate in sending us you application.

We will be delighted to consider you for this position.

Please note that only applications submitted with CV, Cover letter & Certificate of Studies will be considered and move forward in the application process.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre the world‚Äôs leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Our Functions teams are right at the centre of our business, making sure we can always get better, every day. Supporting the business with things like Marketing, Human Resources, Finance, Legal and Technology, our Functions colleagues are skilled professionals whose role it is to ensure we continue to become an indispensable partner to brands everywhere.

Job Details

About the BI Team: The Kantar BI team is a dynamic, integrated function that delivers expert data tools and insights to Finance across Kantar. Our primary focus is to empower business teams with seamless access to high-quality data while managing best-in-class business intelligence solutions. By enhancing data quality and streamlining BI processes, we drive operational excellence and elevate the overall business experience.

Why this job is important

As a Business Intelligence Analyst within Kantar‚Äôs BI team, you will play a key role in executing and supporting the company‚Äôs business intelligence strategy. Reporting directly to the BI Manager, you will be responsible for delivering high-quality reporting, analytics, and data-driven insights that align with strategic objectives. Your contributions will help transform raw data into valuable business intelligence, whether through reports, analyses, or by enhancing the team‚Äôs existing BI assets.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Project Ownership: Take charge of assigned projects, ensuring alignment with team priorities and strategic goals. Oversee the entire delivery process from inception to completion, adhering to deadlines and maintaining quality standards.
Data Analysis & Reporting: Create and sustain strategic dashboards, offering data-driven insights regarding performance across all financial dimensions.
Stakeholder Management: Manage stakeholder expectations throughout the project lifecycle. Provide regular updates on project progress, address concerns, and ensure deliverables meet stakeholder requirements.
Advanced Analytics Support: Facilitate the application of advanced analytics models, such as forecasting, collaborating with the BI Manager to ensure new models are seamlessly incorporated into existing systems and processes.
Continuous Improvement: Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives by identifying areas for process optimization and innovation. Support the team‚Äôs efforts to enhance reporting and analytics capabilities by facilitating automation of reporting with BI Tools.
Collaboration & Communication: Work closely with all team members to ensure effective collaboration. Communicate effectively to ensure alignment on project goals and deliverables.
Training & Education: Participate in training and education programs to enhance your BI skills and knowledge. Support the broader team‚Äôs efforts to promote a data-driven culture within the organisation.


The Skills & Experience Needed As Business Intelligence Analyst


Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration, engineering, data science, computer science, or a related field.
Experience: Previous experience in a business intelligence, data analysis, or similar role.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in BI tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, or MicroStrategy), data analysis techniques, and proficiency in Excel. Familiarity with ERP Reporting Platforms (Maconomy, SAP, Oracle) is a plus.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
Task Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with team priorities.
Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to engage effectively with senior stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: A proactive approach to problem-solving, with the ability to identify challenges and develop effective solutions.
Collaboration: A team player with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional environment.


What‚Äôs In It For You


Flexible hybrid working
Up to 25 days off, plus your birthday off and two days paid for volunteering
Meal card and flexible benefits where you are allocated funds to spend on a variety of benefits such as transport cost, education related and more


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We‚Äôre dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you‚Äôre not an exact match, we‚Äôd love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Data Analytics Consultant
HTML:
Retail Consult is recruiting!


The impact of technology in retail is a game changer affecting every retailer from small, local shops to retail giants. Working at Retail Consult means being at the center of this industry in transformation. As specialists in technology solutions for retail, we provide solutions strategy, implementation, deployment, training, and support services for clients across a range of retail segments including fashion, grocery, pharmacy, do it yourself, telecommunications, and electronics. Work, train and learn with a growing team with over 300 people based in Portugal, the US, Germany, Brazil, Mexico, Chile, and China, who are transforming the business of retailers across the globe.


We are currently seeking for a Data Analytics Consultant to join our growing Delivery team in Porto, Portugal.


What we are offering:

  • The opportunity to join a growing company with people passionate about their work in an international environment;
  • The opportunity to work with best-in-breed methodologies, tools, and techniques;
  • Training and Mentoring/Talent Development programs;
  • Full package of Salary, perks, and benefits (Health Insurance, mobile allowance, and others);
  • Career Evolution;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Extra days off;
  • Wellbeing program;
  • Partnerships with local businesses.


What you‚Äôll be doing:

  • Play a central role in the restructuring of our Data Analytics/BI Practice;
  • Contribute to the definition of best practices, methodologies and Ways of Working;
  • Collaborate with clients to define clear, data-driven visions as part of business transformation programs in large organizations;
  • Implement solutions that typically include Oracle Retail Insights in a combination of other market-leader Analytics platforms;
  • Design optimal data architecture solutions according to business processes, including KPIs, Metrics and Workflows;
  • Conduct data, AI, and governance readiness assessments
  • Create actionable roadmaps to maximize data and AI value
  • Implement data governance strategies addressing security, privacy, and compliance
  • Analyze and synthesize insights from surveys, interviews, and workshops
  • Estimate scope, duration, and cost of data, BI, and AI initiatives
  • Provide training and guidance to end-users, empowering clients to maximize the value of BI and AI tools;
  • Lead BI/Analytics workstreams and projects, overseeing solution delivery and managing a dedicated team;



What we are looking for:

  • Proven experience in BI and Analytics best practices;
  • Experience as a System Integrator (SI) in BI implementations;
  • Strong ability to guide and support clients in the use and adoption of BI platforms;
  • Exposure to and understanding of business processes supported by BI/Analytics solutions;
  • Availability to travel;
  • Excellent communication skills in English.


What would be a plus:

  • Degree in Business, Management, or Engineering-related fields;
  • Experience in Retail;
  • Experience with Oracle Retail Insights;
  • Knowledge in Oracle BI Cloud stack;
  • Proficiency in Spanish, French or German.


If you think your profile matches our requirements and you are looking for an experience that offers opportunity, growth, balance, and a feeling of value, apply to this job submitting your CV at: www.retail-consult.com/en/work-with-us/ or jobs@retail-consult.com.


Retail Consult ‚Äì Transforming Retail with Passion

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.


What are we looking for?

  • +4 years of experience as a Data Analyst;
  • Strong experience with Alteryx;
  • Experience with Alteryx Server and Alteryx Design;
  • Good Knowledge of SQL and PowerBI;
  • Knowledge in Agile methodologies and tools;
  • Fluent in English


What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee ‚Äì the system that includes Aubay‚Äôs Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Working model: Hybrid.
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.


What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • Lounge;
  • We don‚Äôt have a dress code;
  • We know your name and all address each other informally;
  • Coffee and varied snacks at your disposal;
  • You will grow in good company.Isn‚Äôt this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?


If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for you at daniela.lesco@aubay.pt.


Personal Data collected by AUBAY PORTUGAL as Data Controller, regarding the identification, contact and professional capabilities of the candidates, in the present procedure, will be processed for the application analysis, having in consideration that the processing is conducted in order to to take the steps, at the request of the data subject, prior to entering into a contract;

Personal data sent through the present application will be kept by Aubay during the application procedure and will remain stored whilst updated (for one year period).

The collected data might be transferred or include other processing actitivites, as long as the data subject is informed, in the occurrence of a standard application and selection procedure, for the compliance of legal obligations for the time required by law.

For any queries or request regarding personal data protection rights, the Data Subject may contact AUBAY PORTUGAL‚Äôs headquarters in Avenida Duque D`√Åvila, n¬∫46 em Lisboa or use the DPO‚Äôs e-mail - dpo@aubay.pt. The Data Subject also has the right to file a complaint with the National Data Protection Authority ‚Äì www.cnpd.pt.

(please do not include data regarding racial or ethnical origins, political opinions, religion, philosophy, biometrical data, health data, sexual life and orientation, or relating to criminal convictions and offences.).

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)
Description:
ü§îWho are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.







üîé We are looking for a Data Analyst (Alteryx)




MAIN TASKS:




Work closely with business users to understand their requirements and solve business problems.
Translate business requirements into Alteryx workflows, collaborating with local and remote IT teams to process and make data available to users.
Develop workflows according to IT software development governance rules.
Analyze, estimate, and define tasks necessary to deliver data projects.
Maintain and evolve assets created during the projects.







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:




Experience: 4+ years in data preparation and data reconciliation.

Technical Skills:

Strong experience with Alteryx (2+ years).
Proficient in SQL.
Experience with VBA.
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or a similar field.

Communication & Soft Skills:

Good communication skills.
Proactive and able to work autonomously.
Strong interest in learning, improving processes, and helping others.
Ability to collaborate effectively within a team and across locations.
Languages: Proficient in English.
Nice to have: Power BI experience, experience in the financial industry, knowledge of agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban), and French language skills.




üìçHybrid Role in Porto!




üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
üìå We're Hiring: Senior Data Analyst | Porto (Hybrid)




Are you ready to take part in data-driven transformation within the Corporate & Investment Banking world? Join us as a Senior Data Analyst to support a major client on key finance and data management initiatives.




üîç About the role

You will play a central role in improving data quality, reporting capabilities, and analytical frameworks that support decision-making across finance departments. Working closely with both business and IT teams, you‚Äôll help ensure that data is accurate, accessible, and used to its fullest potential.




üéØ What you‚Äôll do:

Analyze, clean, and structure data to support finance operations
Build and maintain BI dashboards and reports (Power BI, Tableau)
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify needs and propose automation solutions
Apply statistical models and advanced data techniques
Support IT-led initiatives by contributing to data architecture and governance
Promote best practices in data visualization and reporting




üìö Key Projects:

Financial data quality & integrity optimization
Cross-team data reporting improvements
Automation and visualization of finance indicators
Support regulatory and internal audit requirements through data




üîß Technical Skills:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst in the banking sector, ideally within CIB
Proficiency with Power BI, Tableau, SQL, DAX, M, and Python
Strong knowledge of data modeling, data manipulation, and predictive analysis
Experience working on IT/data projects in a complex environment




üåê Language Skills:

Fluency in English (mandatory)
Other languages are a plus




üí° Soft Skills:

Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail
Excellent communication skills across business and technical teams
Ability to formalize complex subjects clearly and concisely
Comfortable working in an international, fast-paced setting




üåç Why join us?

Be part of a dynamic, multicultural team driving innovation and compliance
Work on impactful, large-scale transformation initiatives
Hybrid work model with a focus on work-life balance
Opportunities for growth within an international organization




If you're passionate about data, eager to work in a financial environment, and ready to take on a new challenge in Porto, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Title: Business Intelligence Associate
Description:
Who We Are

The next step of your career starts here, where you can bring your own unique mix of skills and perspectives to a fast-growing team.Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working with a vibrant and dynamic team.
A modern office with everything you need (including food and beverages).
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Do


Design visually appealing and business useful reports.
Understand client requirement and suggest right technical architecture.
Developing technically efficient, fast, useful and appealing reports.
Technical problem solving - good knowledge of DAX and data modelling.
Preparing and facilitating workshops.
Managing stakeholders and communicating with executives.



What you‚Äôll bring


3+ years of experience in PowerBI/ BI design and development.
Prior experience in customer facing role across functions is good to have.
In-depth understand of data modelling and basics of azure environment.
Solid understanding and working experience of other BI tools and powerapps.
Profound knowledge of the English language.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Mozantech is a Tech Company from Porto specialized in Web Digital Experiences. Our team is able to deliver high-tech solutions, consulting, turn-key projects and nearshoring. We develop projects for different markets such as banking, finance, insurance, industry, networks, telecommunications, services, utilities and distribution.

Title: Power BI Analyst
Description:
We like to solve problems, and we can‚Äôt go a day without looking for innovative solutions. Ytech is a technological start-up focused on IT and Telecommunications that operates in two main areas: national project development and remote international projects.




üöÄ Ready to join us, Power BI Analyst?




Key Responsibilities

Design, build, and maintain effective and user-friendly Power BI dashboards and reports.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, seasonality, and data behaviors.
Clearly communicate analytical findings and data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Work independently with a proactive and problem-solving attitude.
Be available to travel internationally for short periods when required.




Main Technical Requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or related fields.
4+ years of hands-on experience with Power BI.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Excellent communication skills to present data-driven insights.
Good command of English (minimum B2 level ‚Äì mandatory).
Fast learner with autonomy and initiative.




Nice to Have / Plus

Experience working alongside Engineering teams on ETL pipelines.
Programming knowledge in Python or R.
Solid understanding of SQL and VBA.
Experience with SSAS, SSIS, and Azure.
Previous exposure to the financial sector.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban).
Knowledge of French is a plus.




What makes us different

Our vision is to innovate and reinvent through technological services, promoting the success of our partners.
Our mission is to connect clients with highly specialized professionals and drive business forward.
Our culture is centred on people and their well-being, which allows us to attract and retain the best talent.







Join the Ytech team! Send your CV to ihilario@ytech.io

Title: Traded Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (‚ÄúRISK MFI‚Äù) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (‚ÄúGM‚Äù) and of Securities and Services with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring.

The Digital team within RISK MFI review processes and develops light IT solutions to automate the many risk management processes and analysis dashboards of the RISK MFI department.

Each project is undertaken in a predefined environment and withing specific guidelines built in coordination with the RISK IT department.

There is a strong focus in improving the user experience and exploiting efficiently and timely the vast amount of available data.

An understanding of the risk management purpose behind those processes is therefore key.

Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs, etc.

The role encompasses the maintenance and support of existing tools, taking the lead on new developments, the close collaboration with the risk managers to shape an efficient visualisation of the data and related workflow of decisions.

The Digital team works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best coding practices are followed. It allows for a smooth the path to production of the tools developed by the team. For many projects, the Digital team directly codes in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues.

The team uses a variety of technologies but specialises in Python, with some exposure to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.

The team is based in London, Lisbon and Porto and operates following Agile principles . The team works alongside around 500 people focusing on Market, Counterparty and Liquidity risk topics.

Your Main Activities Are


Inquisitive with a strong willingness to understand financial risk management, with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to gather, integrate, process and simplify large amounts of information
Ability to ensure the relevancy of the work done, the correct presentation of details and the full accomplishment of tasks
Value and integrate client's feedback to improve products, services and processes.
Aims at increasing client satisfaction and anticipating their needs.
Ability to anticipate and takes initiative to answer a particular situation, to learn from experiences and to deploy curiosity about topics outside their immediate scope.
Ability to manage time, to plan, structure, prioritise and coordinate activities and resources effectively to reach objectives.


Profile And Skills To Success


A strong appetite to working in the financial industry and understanding of financial risk management,
An experience related to financial markets and risk management is an advantage
Master‚Äôs degree in Finance, Mathematics, Science or Engineering.
2 to 5 years of working experience in a relevant data analysis field.
On programming skills, a solid working knowledge of Python is required, with a strong understanding of numpy, pandas, etc


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Service - Dataviz (SCD)
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. Also, part of our culture is our concern for the environment and the implementation of social and environmental corporate responsibility actions.

This could be your opportunity to join a company of international scope, with a project that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

üíª THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Service ‚Äì Dataviz for an international project.

üôÇ YOUR DAY TO DAY


Get Knowledge over data visualization products, its features and several use cases.
Supervise and maintain Qlik Sense, BO and PowerBI applications.
Support users, manage and administrate Qlik Sense, BO and PowerBI applications.
Maintain operational readiness Qlik Sense, BO and PowerBI applications and their infrastructure ensuring technologic follow up roadmap (upgrade, security, availability, performance, volumes, solcing problem,‚Ä¶)
Contribute to the RUN tasks to maintain the Data Visualization products, and, above all, have a critical point of view to propose/implement the improvements needed to simplify/make the tasks more reliable
Get and keep informed about strategic plan of the Data Visualization products to define and lead actions to adapt the applications (Qlik Sense, BO, PowerBI)
Give advices and support to the IT developers and business lines users to build their projects and reports into Qlik Sense application
Contribute to migration project of BO dashboards to Qlik Sense or PowerBI
Contribute to implement PowerBI application and to define and deploy the service offering managed by the squad
Actively participate in projects by helping others squad members or business line users, managing, and doing building phases of dataviz
Write user guide and application support documentation
Contribute to all agile rituals


üí° WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


Qlik Sense (expert including admistration)
Power BI (master, advanced administrator)
Relational data bases (Oracle, Exadata, PostGre, SQL,‚Ä¶) (master)
Fluency in French (C2) and English (B2)


‚≠ê WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject DSD/AS/MO‚Äù.

Learn more about Axians
