Title: Traded Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (‚ÄúRISK MFI‚Äù) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (‚ÄúGM‚Äù) and of Securities and Services with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring.

The Digital team within RISK MFI review processes and develops light IT solutions to automate the many risk management processes and analysis dashboards of the RISK MFI department.

Each project is undertaken in a predefined environment and withing specific guidelines built in coordination with the RISK IT department.

There is a strong focus in improving the user experience and exploiting efficiently and timely the vast amount of available data.

An understanding of the risk management purpose behind those processes is therefore key.

Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs, etc.

The role encompasses the maintenance and support of existing tools, taking the lead on new developments, the close collaboration with the risk managers to shape an efficient visualisation of the data and related workflow of decisions.

The Digital team works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best coding practices are followed. It allows for a smooth the path to production of the tools developed by the team. For many projects, the Digital team directly codes in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues.

The team uses a variety of technologies but specialises in Python, with some exposure to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.

The team is based in London, Lisbon and Porto and operates following Agile principles . The team works alongside around 500 people focusing on Market, Counterparty and Liquidity risk topics.

Your Main Activities Are


Inquisitive with a strong willingness to understand financial risk management, with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to gather, integrate, process and simplify large amounts of information
Ability to ensure the relevancy of the work done, the correct presentation of details and the full accomplishment of tasks
Value and integrate client's feedback to improve products, services and processes.
Aims at increasing client satisfaction and anticipating their needs.
Ability to anticipate and takes initiative to answer a particular situation, to learn from experiences and to deploy curiosity about topics outside their immediate scope.
Ability to manage time, to plan, structure, prioritise and coordinate activities and resources effectively to reach objectives.


Profile And Skills To Success


A strong appetite to working in the financial industry and understanding of financial risk management,
An experience related to financial markets and risk management is an advantage
Master‚Äôs degree in Finance, Mathematics, Science or Engineering.
2 to 5 years of working experience in a relevant data analysis field.
On programming skills, a solid working knowledge of Python is required, with a strong understanding of numpy, pandas, etc


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

HTML:
About The Job

The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (‚ÄúRISK MFI‚Äù) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (‚ÄúGM‚Äù) and of Securities and Services with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring.

The Digital team within RISK MFI review processes and develops light IT solutions to automate the many risk management processes and analysis dashboards of the RISK MFI department.

Each project is undertaken in a predefined environment and withing specific guidelines built in coordination with the RISK IT department.

There is a strong focus in improving the user experience and exploiting efficiently and timely the vast amount of available data.

An understanding of the risk management purpose behind those processes is therefore key.

Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs, etc.

The role encompasses the maintenance and support of existing tools, taking the lead on new developments, the close collaboration with the risk managers to shape an efficient visualisation of the data and related workflow of decisions.

The Digital team works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best coding practices are followed. It allows for a smooth the path to production of the tools developed by the team. For many projects, the Digital team directly codes in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues.

The team uses a variety of technologies but specialises in Python, with some exposure to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.

The team is based in London, Lisbon and Porto and operates following Agile principles . The team works alongside around 500 people focusing on Market, Counterparty and Liquidity risk topics.

Your Main Activities Are

  • Inquisitive with a strong willingness to understand financial risk management, with a strong attention to detail.
  • Ability to gather, integrate, process and simplify large amounts of information
  • Ability to ensure the relevancy of the work done, the correct presentation of details and the full accomplishment of tasks
  • Value and integrate client's feedback to improve products, services and processes.
  • Aims at increasing client satisfaction and anticipating their needs.
  • Ability to anticipate and takes initiative to answer a particular situation, to learn from experiences and to deploy curiosity about topics outside their immediate scope.
  • Ability to manage time, to plan, structure, prioritise and coordinate activities and resources effectively to reach objectives.

Profile And Skills To Success

  • A strong appetite to working in the financial industry and understanding of financial risk management,
  • An experience related to financial markets and risk management is an advantage
  • Master‚Äôs degree in Finance, Mathematics, Science or Engineering.
  • 2 to 5 years of working experience in a relevant data analysis field.
  • On programming skills, a solid working knowledge of Python is required, with a strong understanding of numpy, pandas, etc

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Service - Dataviz (SCD)
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. Also, part of our culture is our concern for the environment and the implementation of social and environmental corporate responsibility actions.

This could be your opportunity to join a company of international scope, with a project that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

üíª THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Service ‚Äì Dataviz for an international project.

üôÇ YOUR DAY TO DAY


Get Knowledge over data visualization products, its features and several use cases.
Supervise and maintain Qlik Sense, BO and PowerBI applications.
Support users, manage and administrate Qlik Sense, BO and PowerBI applications.
Maintain operational readiness Qlik Sense, BO and PowerBI applications and their infrastructure ensuring technologic follow up roadmap (upgrade, security, availability, performance, volumes, solcing problem,‚Ä¶)
Contribute to the RUN tasks to maintain the Data Visualization products, and, above all, have a critical point of view to propose/implement the improvements needed to simplify/make the tasks more reliable
Get and keep informed about strategic plan of the Data Visualization products to define and lead actions to adapt the applications (Qlik Sense, BO, PowerBI)
Give advices and support to the IT developers and business lines users to build their projects and reports into Qlik Sense application
Contribute to migration project of BO dashboards to Qlik Sense or PowerBI
Contribute to implement PowerBI application and to define and deploy the service offering managed by the squad
Actively participate in projects by helping others squad members or business line users, managing, and doing building phases of dataviz
Write user guide and application support documentation
Contribute to all agile rituals


üí° WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


Qlik Sense (expert including admistration)
Power BI (master, advanced administrator)
Relational data bases (Oracle, Exadata, PostGre, SQL,‚Ä¶) (master)
Fluency in French (C2) and English (B2)


‚≠ê WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject DSD/AS/MO‚Äù.

Learn more about Axians

Title: Risk Data Analyst - RISK EM
Description:
About The Job

Within the Group RISK Function, the main mission of RISK EM is to manage credit risk, counterparty risk, market risk and operational risk within the Retail Banking perimeter, which covers Central Europe (Poland, Ukraine), Turkey and the Maghreb (Morocco and Algeria) to:


Contribute to the implementation of a robust risk management framework within the scope,
Monitor and control risks on its perimeter, providing a dynamic and comprehensive analysis of all the risks incurred within its scope,
Ensure compliance with banking regulations in the risk area, in conjunction with the relevant functions within its scope.


Your Main Activities Are

Supporting the EM Risk teams


Framework, planning and budgeting of work
Coordination and development of supporting materials in response to ad hoc requests from the Group (e.g. Stress Tests, ETS, CRR impact study)
Participate in the preparation of materials & minutes for project committees, steering committees and strategic committees (AQC)
Ensure the update of EM policies on non-performing loans, and coordinate cascading within EM entities and monitor operational implementation.
Production of adequate documentation in line with Group Documentation


As part of B-Ready program for the implementation of CRR3 guidelines,


Coordinate actions to ensure the sourcing of CRR3 data, and support EM entities in the certification phase of the calculation of the CRR3 RWA.
Integration of additional regulatory data into local systems required to calculate the RWA according to the Bale 4 standards.
Coordination of the certification phase (Dry Run) and support to entities for data verification, understanding and interpretation of results, as well as implementation of action plans.


Supporting the Risk EM central teams as a PMO on the Prudential Backstops project


Support entities for the shortfall computation, in respect of the timeline imposed by the regulator and by the Group.
Organize workshops with entities and ensure the minutes with the monitoring of action / decisions exchanges.
Collect, control and consolidate the shortfall computed by entities,
Lead the building of the forecast assumption of provisioning evolution.


Ensure the data collection for the Stress Test EBA 2023 and Stress Test CRE


Collect Group needs and share the instructions to EM entities
Monitor the progress of the work in relation to the plans imposed.
Provide support to EM entities in their collection work (prioritization, identification of alternative solutions in case of missing data


Coordinate The Data Reliability Actions Used To Meet The Calculation Needs Of IFRS9 Provisions (Stages 1, 2 And 3), Shortfalls Computation And More Generally On All Projects Monitored By The Team


Support BMCI in identifying data corrections/development, defining and operational monitoring of action plans with a view to improving reliability and data collection.
Monitor the correction actions and the implementation of IT roadmaps for data implementation, feeding and control.


Monitor the implementation of indicators of financial difficulties in the credit process


Monitoring the integration of UTP in the credit process, in the respect of the regulatory deliverables.
Maintenance of the UTP dashboard for monitoring UTP deployment.
Communicate and control the application of updated instructions.


Profile And Skills To Success


2/3 years of experience in same or related field
Data knowledge
Risk analysis
Culture Transformation Change Management
Process improvement
Project management
Active collaboration
Adaptability
English (mandatory): fluent
French (recommended): Operational


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst | ETL Developer
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business.

We are looking for a Data Analyst | ETL Developer to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid).

Requirements

  • Between 3 to 6 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related role;
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field;
  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role (+ 3 years);
  • Knowledge of SQL for data extraction and manipulation;
  • Familiarity with ETL processes; experience with Stambia is a plus;
  • Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is a plus;
  • Proficiency in Power BI for data visualization and reporting is a plus;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Excellent communication skills in both French and English;
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment;
  • Must be french-speaker, at least C1.

We Offer

  • Health insurance;
  • A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
  • Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
  • Remote onboarding process;
  • Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
  • Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Apply

If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate to apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: Finance Data Operations Analyst
Description:
We have an exciting opportunity to join our high-performing team as a driven, ambitious, and adaptable finance data operations analyst, who takes a hands-on approach to their daily responsibilities of key back-office processes. üöÄ




We are looking for a superstar who can be integral to the future of the finance function.

The role will suit an individual with great analytical skills who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure in an exciting start-up. This could be your opportunity to join a high-growth company and compete with your skills, knowledge, and exposure to build yourself and build the company simultaneously. This individual will form a core part of the Global Finance team, within the FinOps subteam and will be responsible for the monitoring of our proprietary payment system ensuring a proper flow of the funds from guest to host. This role will be based in Portugal but will be working for all our Global markets.




Key Responsibilities:

Daily reconciliation of incoming and outgoing transfers within the payment system (identifying misconfigurations and miscalculations)
Identification of flaws and improvements needed on the flow to ensure the minimum delay in the payouts
Partner with our product team to improve our proprietary payment system
Collaborate with other teams to drive operational efficiency and process improvements
Maintain and improve fin-ops reports
Assist in ad hoc analyses for Finance or other teams

What We‚Äôre Looking For:

Based in Porto area
Strong analytical and quantitative skills, particularly using Excel (super user); comfort working with large data sets and the ability to identify data inconsistencies and patterns
Studied advanced mathematics
Project Management skills
SQL knowledge
Comfortable navigating cloud applications
Fluent in English and Portuguese (C1/C2)
Analytical, problem-solving mind
Detail-oriented, with a strong focus on quality
Able to multitask, and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
A proactive hands-on attitude
The ability to work with the highest ethical and professional quality standards
Previous experience working in a startup environment would be an advantage




Why You'll Love Working with Us:

üè° Hybrid work flexibility (1-2 days/week in Porto).
üöÄ Join a fast-growing company in the booming travel industry.
üåç Work in a dynamic, multicultural team.
üìö Opportunities for learning and career development.
üè• Comprehensive health insurance.
üßò Focus on wellbeing with supportive activities.
üêæ Pet-friendly office!

We‚Äôre excited to hear from you and discover how you can contribute to our journey! Apply now!üì©

Description:
M/F

Procuramos um Data Scientist com experi√™ncia, esp√≠rito cr√≠tico e gosto no contacto com o neg√≥cio para integrar a nossa equipa de Data Science. Trabalhamos em projetos para as diferentes √°reas da empresa, transformando dados em insights que orientam decis√µes estrat√©gicas.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!
At InnoTech, it‚Äôs all about connecting people with business through technology.
We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek passionate individuals eager to learn and improve their skills with us ‚Äì growth is in our DNA. This dedication has earned us recognition as a Best Workplace in Portugal for 2023 and 2024. Furthermore, in 2024, we were proudly acknowledged as one of the top IT companies to work for in Portugal, receiving the Best Workplace award in the IT sector, given by Great Place to Work.
For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.
We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You can work with top-level partners in banking, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and more!
Join our team of 180+ InnoTechers and bring your talent as a Data Analyst.
Your Mission Will Be

Collaborate with stakeholders across various sectors to identify and understand their analytical needs and challenges;
Map business requirements to existing analytics product functionality, identifying opportunities for enhancement and customization;
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI, ensuring they deliver actionable insights;
Ensure the quality and integrity of the data used for analysis.

You Will Need

Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis;
Proven proficiency in the Power BI tool, including development of dashboards and reports;
Experience working with Snowflake and Azure Databricks;
Fluency in Portuguese and English;
CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.

Would Be Awesome If You Have

BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields;
Experience working with SQL Server.

With Us You Can Be a

TechThinker ‚Äì people who want to re-imagine technology with us
TechSolver ‚Äì strategic, resilient, and a little bit of a puzzle lover
InnoMinder ‚Äì inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
InnoTecher ‚Äì no words needed. Just happiness, talent, and all the above!

Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.
Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Databank Operations Specialist
Description:
We are seeking a talented individual to join our Databank/Style team at Mercer. This role will be based in Lisbon. This is a hybrid role that has a requirement of working at least three days a week in the office.

The Databank/Style Team works as a close partner of the Wealth Consulting teams worldwide. We manage the content of Mercer‚Äôs proprietary database storing index values, economic data, as well as the content for Style Analytics ‚Äì global source of Style and Research Analysis for equity funds for Mercer Researchers and Consultants on a global scale.

The team works daily with Mercer users worldwide, ensuring they are provided with accurate, up to date investment data from our platforms. Daily work involves communication with a variety of colleagues from Mercer offices, teams and seniority all over the world (from Canada to Japan or Australia). Although strong communication skills are needed, there is a significant part of the work that involves troubleshooting and strong problem-solving skills, all while providing close contact with the platforms internal users and managing expectations.

We will count on you to:


Resolve and troubleshoot field queries.
Manage internal client‚Äôs expectations.
Monitoring requests efficiently.
Enhancing project guidelines and focusing on project optimization.
Support the greater use of Databank within the business (e.g.: Delegated Solutions content).
Liaise with other Mercer teams to resolve outages or delayed refreshes.


What are we looking for?


Bachelors or Master‚Äôs in Finance, Economics, Management, Engineering or similar (desirable but not mandatory).
Understanding of Investments and Finance concepts (desirable but not mandatory).
Fluent in English (C1/C2 level, verbal and written).
Ability to work along different cultures and create strong relationships with colleagues.
Proactivity.
Strong Communication skills ‚Äì clear and assertive.


What makes you stand out?


Lean mindset.
Strong Microsoft Office skills, including Word, Excel and Powerpoint.
Customer Service mindset.
Problem-solver, presenting capacity to identify and propose solutions.
Organizational skills.


Why join our team:


We help you be your best through professional development opportunities, interesting work and supportive leaders.
We foster a vibrant and inclusive culture where you can work with talented colleagues to create new solutions and have impact for colleagues, clients and communities.
Our scale enables us to provide a range of career opportunities, as well as benefits and rewards to enhance your well-being.


Mercer, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a global leader in helping clients realize their investment objectives, shape the future of work and enhance health and retirement outcomes for their people. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit mercer.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.

Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one ‚Äúanchor day‚Äù per week on which their full team will be together in person.

Title: Senior Risk Data Analyst - Fincrime & Fraud Monitoring
Description:
Company Description

Hello! We're Teya.

Teya is a payment and software service provider, headquartered in London serving small, local businesses across Europe. Founded in 2019, we build easy to use, integrated tools that enable our members to accept payments and boost business performance.

At Teya we believe small, local businesses are the lifeblood of our communities.

We‚Äôre here because we don‚Äôt believe there‚Äôs a level playing field that gives small businesses with a fighting chance against the giants of the high street.

We‚Äôre here because we see banks and legacy service providers making things harder for them. We don‚Äôt think the best technology or the best service should be reserved for those with the biggest headquarters.

We‚Äôre here to fight for a future where small, local businesses can thrive, and to commit the same dedication they offer all of us.

Become a part of our story.

We‚Äôre looking for exceptional talent to join our mission. We offer a chance to create impact in a high-energy and connected culture, while benefiting from continuous learning opportunities, a supportive community which is proud to serve our mission, and comprehensive benefits.

Job Description

The Team

The Customer Risk Monitoring team is responsible for implementing and maintaining the analytical intelligence that protects Teya and its customers from financial risks, including fraud, money laundering, and terrorism financing. Our goal is to minimise financial losses and risk exposure while supporting and maintaining our customers' trust and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.

We work closely with the Operations team to investigate suspicious activities and collaborate cross-functionally with Compliance, Risk, Platform Engineering and product leaders to build and continuously improve the intelligence powering our detection and monitoring systems.

The role

As a Data Analyst in the Customer Risk Monitoring team, you will:


Develop and refine the intelligence used to detect financial crime, balancing efficacy with operational efficiency to reduce false positives, investigation time, and customer friction
Deliver actionable insights that directly improve detection rates, uncover new risk patterns, and inform prevention strategies
Act as a bridge between data and the business, collaborating closely with Operations, Compliance, Engineering, and Product teams to shape and prioritise analytical initiatives
Identify opportunities to improve and automate monitoring, escalate emerging threats, and continuously evolve our understanding of risk
Build and maintain clear and impactful dashboards, reports, and documentation to monitor key metrics, surface relevant trends, and drive data-informed decisions
Partner with data engineering to design and maintain scalable, reliable data models and ETLs that underpin both operational and strategic use cases
Help define and analyse fraud and AML KPIs, helping the business plan and course-correct with confidence
Promote a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organisation


Qualifications

We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Data Analyst with a strong analytical foundation and a passion for tackling complex, ambiguous problems in the financial risk domain.

Must-haves


4+ years of professional experience as a data analyst, preferably in fraud, AML, or financial risk monitoring
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and experience applying methods such as forecasting, time series analysis, A/B testing, or regression analysis
Experience in producing insights that led to measurable improvements, ideally in relevant domains such as fraud, AML detection, or operations
Advanced proficiency in SQL and experience working with large, complex, and sometimes messy datasets
Experience designing, building, and maintaining ETL pipelines or data models, ideally using tools like dbt
Proficiency in Python for data analysis, including data manipulation, visualisation, and basic modelling
Strong data storytelling and communication skills: you can translate complex data into clear, actionable recommendations for both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Experience working collaboratively with cross-functional partners, including Operations, Compliance, Engineering and Product
Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, high-ambiguity environment and takes ownership of their work from start to finish


Nice-to-haves


Experience in acquiring services or the payments industry
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics)
Direct experience with problems such as AML scenario tuning, fraud rule optimisation, or detection intelligence design
Familiarity with regulatory or compliance-driven analytics environments
Fincrime certifications such as CAMS, ICA, or equivalent


Additional Information

The Perks


We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;
Health Insurance;
Meal Allowance;
25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);
Public Transportation Card;
Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside;
Office snacks every day;
Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment.

  • We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;
  • Health Insurance;

  • 25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);
  • Public Transportation Card;
  • Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside;
  • Office snacks every day;
  • Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment.

Title: Data Engineer (Power BI)
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid).


Requirements:

-Between 3 to 6 years of experience;

-Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;

-4+ years of experience with Power BI;

-Analytical mindset, to analyze large amounts of data and identify patterns, trends, seasonality and other data behaviors;

-Clearly communicate data insights, findings and results to internal and external stakeholders;

-Good level of English - minimum B2 (mandatory);

-Able to be quickly autonomous, proactive;

-Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required.


Nice to Have:

-Experience working with Engineering on ETL pipelines;

-Experience with programming languages such as Python or R;

- Good understanding of SQL and VBA;

-Good understanding of SSAS, SSIS and Azure;

-Previous experience on financial area;

-Knowledge in agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban);

- Good level of French.


We offer:

- Health insurance;

- A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;

- Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;

- Remote onboarding process;

- Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;

- Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Title: Senior Risk Data Analyst - RISK EM
Description:
About The Job

Within the Group RISK Function, the main mission of RISK EM is to manage credit risk, counterparty risk, market risk and operational risk within the Retail Banking perimeter, which covers Central Europe (Poland, Ukraine), Turkey and the Maghreb (Morocco and Algeria) to:


Contribute to the implementation of a robust risk management framework within the scope,
Monitor and control risks on its perimeter, providing a dynamic and comprehensive analysis of all the risks incurred within its scope,
Ensure compliance with banking regulations in the risk area, in conjunction with the relevant functions within its scope.


Your Main Activities Are

Supporting the EM Risk teams


Framework, planning and budgeting of work
Coordination and development of supporting materials in response to ad hoc requests from the Group (e.g. Stress Tests, ETS, CRR impact study)
Participate in the preparation of materials & minutes for project committees, steering committees and strategic committees (AQC)
Ensure the update of EM policies on non-performing loans, and coordinate cascading within EM entities and monitor operational implementation.
Production of adequate documentation in line with Group Documentation


As part of B-Ready program for the implementation of CRR3 guidelines,


Coordinate actions to ensure the sourcing of CRR3 data, and support EM entities in the certification phase of the calculation of the CRR3 RWA.
Integration of additional regulatory data into local systems required to calculate the RWA according to the Bale 4 standards.
Coordination of the certification phase (Dry Run) and support to entities for data verification, understanding and interpretation of results, as well as implementation of action plans.


Supporting the Risk EM central teams as a PMO on the Prudential Backstops project


Support entities for the shortfall computation, in respect of the timeline imposed by the regulator and by the Group.
Organize workshops with entities and ensure the minutes with the monitoring of action / decisions exchanges.
Collect, control and consolidate the shortfall computed by entities,
Lead the building of the forecast assumption of provisioning evolution.


Ensure the data collection for the Stress Test EBA 2023 and Stress Test CRE


Collect Group needs and share the instructions to EM entities
Monitor the progress of the work in relation to the plans imposed.
Provide support to EM entities in their collection work (prioritization, identification of alternative solutions in case of missing data


Coordinate The Data Reliability Actions Used To Meet The Calculation Needs Of IFRS9 Provisions (Stages 1, 2 And 3), Shortfalls Computation And More Generally On All Projects Monitored By The Team


Support BMCI in identifying data corrections/development, defining and operational monitoring of action plans with a view to improving reliability and data collection.
Monitor the correction actions and the implementation of IT roadmaps for data implementation, feeding and control.


Monitor the implementation of indicators of financial difficulties in the credit process


Monitoring the integration of UTP in the credit process, in the respect of the regulatory deliverables.
Maintenance of the UTP dashboard for monitoring UTP deployment.
Communicate and control the application of updated instructions.


Profile And Skills To Success


4/5 years of experience in same or related field
Data knowledge
Risk analysis
Culture Transformation Change Management
Process improvement
Project management
Active collaboration
Adaptability
English (mandatory): fluent
French (recommended): Operational


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

About The Job

Within the Group RISK Function, the main mission of RISK EM is to manage credit risk, counterparty risk, market risk and operational risk within the Retail Banking perimeter, which covers Central Europe (Poland, Ukraine), Turkey and the Maghreb (Morocco and Algeria) to:

  • Contribute to the implementation of a robust risk management framework within the scope,
  • Monitor and control risks on its perimeter, providing a dynamic and comprehensive analysis of all the risks incurred within its scope,
  • Ensure compliance with banking regulations in the risk area, in conjunction with the relevant functions within its scope.

Your Main Activities Are

Supporting the EM Risk teams

  • Framework, planning and budgeting of work
  • Coordination and development of supporting materials in response to ad hoc requests from the Group (e.g. Stress Tests, ETS, CRR impact study)
  • Participate in the preparation of materials & minutes for project committees, steering committees and strategic committees (AQC)
  • Ensure the update of EM policies on non-performing loans, and coordinate cascading within EM entities and monitor operational implementation.
  • Production of adequate documentation in line with Group Documentation

As part of B-Ready program for the implementation of CRR3 guidelines,

  • Coordinate actions to ensure the sourcing of CRR3 data, and support EM entities in the certification phase of the calculation of the CRR3 RWA.
  • Integration of additional regulatory data into local systems required to calculate the RWA according to the Bale 4 standards.
  • Coordination of the certification phase (Dry Run) and support to entities for data verification, understanding and interpretation of results, as well as implementation of action plans.

Supporting the Risk EM central teams as a PMO on the Prudential Backstops project

  • Support entities for the shortfall computation, in respect of the timeline imposed by the regulator and by the Group.
  • Organize workshops with entities and ensure the minutes with the monitoring of action / decisions exchanges.
  • Collect, control and consolidate the shortfall computed by entities,
  • Lead the building of the forecast assumption of provisioning evolution.

Ensure the data collection for the Stress Test EBA 2023 and Stress Test CRE

  • Collect Group needs and share the instructions to EM entities
  • Monitor the progress of the work in relation to the plans imposed.
  • Provide support to EM entities in their collection work (prioritization, identification of alternative solutions in case of missing data

Coordinate The Data Reliability Actions Used To Meet The Calculation Needs Of IFRS9 Provisions (Stages 1, 2 And 3), Shortfalls Computation And More Generally On All Projects Monitored By The Team

  • Support BMCI in identifying data corrections/development, defining and operational monitoring of action plans with a view to improving reliability and data collection.
  • Monitor the correction actions and the implementation of IT roadmaps for data implementation, feeding and control.

Monitor the implementation of indicators of financial difficulties in the credit process

  • Monitoring the integration of UTP in the credit process, in the respect of the regulatory deliverables.
  • Maintenance of the UTP dashboard for monitoring UTP deployment.
  • Communicate and control the application of updated instructions.

Profile And Skills To Success

  • 4/5 years of experience in same or related field
  • Data knowledge
  • Risk analysis
  • Culture Transformation Change Management
  • Process improvement
  • Project management
  • Active collaboration
  • Adaptability
  • English (mandatory): fluent
  • French (recommended): Operational
